Reviews.Title: “Really great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rosyblu
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here from researching on TripAdvisor.We were pleasantly surprised. We arrived quite early - around 11.00am. and no problems, our room was ready!! The porter was lovely and we could park our rental car out the front while we checked in. Reception staff were pleasant and helpful the whole time we were there (5 days) - always friendly. We had an urban suite, which was plenty of room. - a bedroom with large TV and sitting room with another large TV. The rooms were clean. The location is great - just down the road from the cable car tunaround and if you want to go to Fishernans Wharf its just a streetcar ride away. There is a nice Italian restaurant downstairs nextdoor., it has a happy hour daily. We really enjoyed our stay here and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, refurbished place, great for couples having fun”
Reviews.Author: Desicarioca_blz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights during our honeymoon. The place reminds me of other hotels in New York and other cities where previous arpartment buildings or industrial spaces have been recently converted into the "boutique" hotel theme - small rooms but equiped with luxury bed/linens, flat screen, I-Home etc. The service is very good and professional. Adjacent to the hotel is a lively happy hour restaurant that appears to become a night scene later on. Overall, for cost and value, a well-run hotel well located down town for who is going to spend a night or two walking round San Fran and hitting the typical tourist and night life places. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Booked room = No room”
Reviews.Author: Nathan M
Reviews.Content: Was travelling down to San Francisco on business and booked two hotel rooms at the last minute - all paid and confirmed...or so we thought. We showed up in a rush between meetings and the front desk informed us that we didn't have rooms any more because the people staying in our rooms had "extended" their stay! Hotel was supposed to find us rooms elsewhere but we ended up scrambling to find two other rooms. Disappointed as we always like to try and find the hidden jewel but this time we certainly found something else. Guess squatters rights still exist in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: klgreene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided last minute to get a hotel on the last night we were in the city, rather than crash on a friend's couch. We are so glad we found this place! Yes, the room was small but very cozy, clean, up-to-date, and somewhat swanky - but in a good way. The bed was super comfy and we had a great night's sleep. Bathroom has just a standing shower, but it was very clean and well maintained. The hotel even served homemade natural energy drinks around happy hour time. It was a convenient location to everything around Union Square. The only con of the experience is that when we were trying to get a cab when we were leaving the concierge did a very poor job of assisting us, and we ended up getting in the taxi stand line at another hotel around the corner. Other than that, it was a perfect place to stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectation”
Reviews.Author: criscross38
Reviews.Content: this hotel was wonderful. booked it on trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Rooms spacious, bed huge, room very clean. Had a room on fourth floor facing onto the street no real view as such but that was not a problem. The staff were helpful and very friendly. Every evening after a day out there was always a welcoming drink waiting at the reception desk. The bar was always busy and lively , the foyer comfortable and cosy . The hotel itself was within easy reach of all transport (we used muni around town which allowed us to use buses and trams etc) The Bart train was easy to use from the airport and stopped just around the corner from the hotel making our arrival and departure simple. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for both its staff, accomodation and location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 2012 Easter weekend. The room was spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were on the 5th floor, an inner courtyard room. The view wasn't spectacular, but who cares. We were there to walk around San Fran and look, not to look out a window. Room was small, but clean clean clean. Love the amenities (the free wi-fi is a huge benefit, you get free 15 mintues a day of internet time in the lobby and can print out boarding passes for free!) The location is great. just one block from Powell Bart station, and from the Market Street public transportation conduit. We were back and fort to the hotel a lot as we could shop, hop the F trolley back to hotel, run up and drop bags off and be back in the thick of things. As well, the front desk staff was all very friendly and helpful. Special shout out to Tyler. But they were all great at giving directions and tips for restaurants and for walking tours. Honestly, we could have booked in another larger, higher star hotel for same money, but I missed that availability by 10 minutes. So glad I did. This hotel and their staff really enhanced our stay in San Fran. If you're in the city to enjoy the city and not to spend hours in your hotel room looking at it through a pane of glass, this is the palce to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: Deldig
Reviews.Content: Right there amoungst the cable cars, union square, transport and shopping yet on a quieter street. Service was great, easily accommodating a 20 month old and holding on to all our luggage. Rooms always clean. May help to rotate the mattresses once in a while though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: TessfromHampton
Reviews.Content: Right near Union Square and some great places to eat. the rooms are clean, the amenities perfect and anything you want to know about the area can be learned from the concierge. About the only thing I would add would be a night-light in the bathroom. I didn't want to turn on a light in the middle of the night while visiting "the facilities" and wound up with a black eye by hitting my head on the sink. (Don't ask how.) Other than that, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: pat f
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond to please. They helped with moving us to a different room when requested. They even moved our luggage and had it waiting in our new room! It was St Patty's Day weekend, so they were super busy, but that didn't matter. I will return when I visit San Fran next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great San Fran hotel”
Reviews.Author: Papindi
Reviews.Content: The Abri is a delightful hotel situated in the heart of downtown - around the corner from the Powell cable car line . Funky decor in the foyer and the rooms well appointed - rooms not large but adequate. Puccini an Pinetti next door linked to the hotel - served good Italian - dined there twice. Winner for me was the front desk staff - could not have been more helpful from booking online at home to assisting with a complicated tour problem when we arrived. Thanks Abri -will recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable boutique hotel right in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbetraveling
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Abri for a conference at the Moscone Convention Center (4 blocks away through Union Square). It was one of the best decisions I've ever made to stay here. Right in the middle of all shopping and the cable car that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were spectacular and super helpful. I got there right in the middle of rain, and of course, forgot my umbrella. The staff were in tune with this, and were able to point me in the direction of the closest store with umbrellas so I wouldn't get too wet (not that this was hard since the hotel is next to everything shopping!) I chose a room facing the street, which yes, there was some noise, as I was warned. But after living in many cities, the noise was not unreasonable. If you are not used to city life, do not choose a room facing the street. The room was small, but comfy. The king bed was soft, and inviting. The bathroom redone to a modern taste. My only complaint was that there was not enough counter/shelf space for my toiletries around the sink. There is free wifi, and every outlet you could possibly need for all your electronics. There was also an ipod dock for your alarm. Each afternoon, there is a "cocktail" waiting for you at the end of the front desk. On the weekend, it was a true cocktail. On the weekdays, just a nice fruity pick me up. Oh, and if you have the chance to have the continental breakfast included in the room, don't bother. I went the first day, and it was a croissant with a small cup of fruit, juice or coffee. Not much. I'd probably go to the Subway next door and get one of their breakfast sandwiches. Overall, I'd definitely stay there again when I go to SF again. It's around the corner from the cable car stop, and right next to the BART. Can't beat the location, great service, comfortable rooms...what more could you want? (ps. I did notice there were some umbrellas by the door when the weather became better. Perhaps a few more umbrellas for the guests to borrow would have been nice)

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: maryjWi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 27 year old son stayed here for 3 nights in a Junior suite, and there was a door between our king bedroom and the sitting area where our son slept on the sofa bed. This room wasn't large, but was well appointed, great towels, We had lots of rainy weather while in SF, so we spent a good amount of time in the room watching the NCAA tourney. The staff was helpful and nice. Our room faced the back and was quiet, even on St. Patick's day. We were steps from the St. Pat's parade, the cablecars, lots of dining and shopping. We were a little jarred by all the homeless in the area, but we've been cooped up in Wisconsin too long! We would highly recommend staying here and will do so again next time in SF

Reviews.Title: “great front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: surfcitytraveler
Reviews.Content: the staff was efficient, courteous, helpful and friendly - in short, they really know how to treat a guest in a way that insures return stays! special kudos go to callie who handled our reservation, volunteered great tips on staying in san francisco and even upgraded our room! when we checked in, we received a warm reception from wilmer who also was more than happy to help us with questions and concerns. throughout our entire stay, both callie and wilmer, as well as the rest of the staff, provided an upbeat, welcoming presence. you cannot beat the location of the hotel: its just around the corner from the powell st. station. we took an easy bart ride in from the airport and within minutes of arriving at the station, we were at our hotel. the westfield centre is very close by and we enjoyed shopping there and also eating at its food court. when you are all shopped out (that'll take a while - the centre is really big!) - you can even take in a movie and popcorn. the movie theater in the centre features a number of current movies - if you are going to any trade shows at the moscone convention center, its an easy walk over there. fyi: most of the shows will provide shuttles from the nearby hotels - ours picked us up outside the hotel and it was just a few minutes ride to the convention center. hotel abri had a big sign in the lobby indicating shuttle pick ups and location. trade shows and business trips can be tedious at times, but a good hotel with a terrific staff can make business travel more pleasurable. hotel abri made it easy for us to combine business with pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: CemJumbo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located, close to shopping and dining areas and mass transit stations. Union Square was a few blocks away. It was well designed and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They recommended us to stay in a backside room to avoid street noise. So will I. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone for its location, friendly staff and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mellani_g
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hotel Abri when i stayed there last september. I arrived at 2am for check in and staff there were still cheerful and very helpful. It is not customary in Europe to have to supply a credit card for a pre-paid booking so i didnt bring one with me. This was not a problem for the staff at the Abri; they just turned off movies and other incidentals in my room (that i wouldnt have used any way) and took a $50 deposit. The suite was very spacious with a living room area complete with fridge and coffee maching (SO important to me!) and a tub in the bathroom. When i ran out of tea, the people on reception quickly sent some more up for me. The location is great for exploring SanFran..so close to Powell bart and union square. Would stay here again. I also thought the price was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Stewart C
Reviews.Content: I was here once before the makeover and name change, and boy have they outdone themselves. Good and abundant friendly service, nice amenities like cold juice shots at check in and cords to borrow in case you need to charge your gadgets on the go. The rooms are comfortable and have nice views of the street (fun place to people watch). The location is excellent for business and shopping and less than a block away from a major mall and the cable cars. I will be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: owt_u
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Abri for one night. The hotel is located a block from the BART Powell Street Station, so it is very convenient being in Union Square. Various restaurants and shops are located all around the hotel. The line for the trolley is less than half a block away. Check-in was very quick and staff was very friendly. Our room was on the second floor. The room was on the smaller side, but it's what I expected in a city like SFO. Room was very clean and modern. Very large LCD TV and desk. One negative part of our room was the noise at night. The room faced Ellis Street and the line for a club across the street was loud late at night. I would recommend a room facing the courtyard if available unless you are going to be out late. Free wireless was available. If you don't mind spending a bit extra on a room, and is your first time in San Francisco, this hotel is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: tarynandcraig
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, prefect location and spotlessly clean. Big suite with tub and coffee machine, helpful staff, just a brilliant stay really. Thanks hotel abri!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms are small!”
Reviews.Author: RawFitness
Reviews.Content: I booked a room online and the room was quoted as being 395.00, which I got for a reduced rate. Upon seeing the room it was the size of a broom closet (i expected a bigger room because of the price)I called and request a room that did not face courtyard and was given a larger room. The staff is really helpful and the location is close to everything. I always love a hotel with heavenly beds and free wifi in the room

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Lucine G
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in downtown SF - Excellent central location to explore rest of the city...very close to Powell and Market Streets, cable car, and BART (super easy to get from airport to hotel via BART - only one block away from hotel) - Super courteous and helpful staff - Clean room albeit a bit small but if you're just in the room to sleep then it's fine plus bed was comfy. - Free Internet Definitely would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Local color”
Reviews.Author: suzpru
Reviews.Content: This hotel puts you in an ideal location to walk all over the city.....from Union Square shopping, to Moscone Center to easy access to cable cars etc. It also puts you in a spot to see (and, not gonna lie, HEAR , local color). It's a bit noisy, but that's all part of a big city vibe. I would certainly stay here again. Small cozy room, L'Occitaine soaps and lotions (yay!) , comfortable beds, gum ball machine at reception desk, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel close to Union square”
Reviews.Author: peating
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night at the beginning of December 2011. The hotel is really modern and found our hotel room to be beautiful and quite spacious. My only complaint about the room was that our view was of a brick wall we would look out our window and would see a brick wall literally maybe 5 feet away...other then that we really enjoyed everything about this hotel! The location and service is top notch and we found the price to be super reasonable! I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it as well!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish modern boutique hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Eyeforquality
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Abri for three nights in December 2011. I had a very pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel highly to visitors to San Francisco. First of all, the hotel has probably the most central and convenient location in San Francisco. Walk a block south and you're at the busy Powell Street-Market Street intersection. This area is a shopping and public transport hub for the city - there's a MUNI booth where you can buy public transport tickets, the main cable car stop for cable cars going north to Fisherman's Wharf and the Powell Street BART Station (where you can catch trains to and from San Francisco International Airport). A couple of blocks north and you're in the Union Square shopping and dining area. The hotel is boutique-style with 91 rooms. It's in a historic building (I'd say built around 1900-1920) which was totally modernized and renovated in 2008. The renovation is impressive - the hotel throughout is clean, fresh and slick with an attractive orange, grey and black themed decor. I particularly liked the gas fireplace area in the lobby - very enticing to lounge about in a San Francisco winter! I paid around $110 per night (it was a holiday special) and for that price, I was expecting a fairly nondescript convention-style hotel. To my surprise, however, my room was of a standard I would have expected to find in a much more expensive and luxurious hotel. My room was thoughtfully laid out to make the most of the space (it didn't feel cramped). It had an iPod player and radio (a bit fiddly to use though) on the bedside table and, best of all, a 42 inch wall-mounted LCD TV. A TV this large was a real treat and a credit to the hotel - far more expensive hotels I've stayed in have a 32 inch TV at best. The bathroom was spacious and looked very new and fresh. One delight was the L'Occitane toiletries - again a brand that would be at home in a more expensive hotel. The in-room WiFi was free, fast and worked well. The only negative about the room is that there was no climate control system in the room, only a window-mounted dual heating/air-conditioning unit. This worked well enough, but took a while to heat the room up on a cold San Francisco winter morning. Overall, though, my room was a pleasure to stay in. The hotel has a young staff who were warm and friendly. When I checked in, I was made to feel welcome and given a choice of rooms (one more spacious, but facing the street and therefore noisier, and one facing the inner courtyard and quieter but a bit smaller). I'm an independent sort of traveller so didn't need their assistance much but the queries I did have were handled promptly, professionally and with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kkbrig
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 daughters stayed at the Hotel Abri Feb. 7-12. What a wonderful stay it was! We had an inner courtyard room and were never bothered by any noise, whether from the outside or from any neighbors. The room was on the small side as others have noted, but not so much that it was a problem. It was well appointed, had a nice large tv, a large desk which was perfect for my husband to do his work on, and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very personable and cheerful! And I mean all the staff- from the guy who opened the door for us, to the front desk, to the cleaning staff! The restaurant which is next door (and connected to the hotel), Puccini and Pinetti, has a great happy hour, and we ate a delicious dinner here one night. Many interesting choices on the menu. Also Daniel's Cafe which is across the street makes nice breakfast sandwiches for take out! The location is incredible. It was a short walk for my husband to go to the convention center. It was less than a block to the cable car line! A couple blocks to Union Square, a block from Market, a ton of shopping and restaurants within a short walking distance. We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites, Quiet, Super location!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a room big enough for two adults and a teen (possibly a king with rollaway or suite) and chose the Abri because of it's location. We had a family event nearby and the taxi's would be impossible because of Chinese New Year parade. WOW! The room had a separate bedroom, pullout sofa and lovely big bathroom. It was spacious, quiet and the hotel itself was very sedate. The front desk staff were a huge plus and always accomodating. If I had to complain, I would mention that there is no mirror in the bedroom, the room was too warm, and booking the room wasn't easy via the phone. However, as we visit S.F. several times a year and generally stay at Starwood hotels (Palace, St. Francis, La Meridien etc.) this is going to be a new favorite. Easy and cheaper for parking, free internet, spacious rooms for 3 and fantastic amenities/staff etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: Hounddog224
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the city and i was pleased with the hotel. From the outside you cant really tell anything but inside it is different. Although small you have all the usual amenities. The free wi-fi is great if you dont have your own laptop. My room had two large beds and a big desk complete with large tv. There wasnt much of a view but i didnt plan to be sitting looking out the window. The room had bathrobes for your use and some lovely toiletries. As for the position of the hotel it is great. No matter which way you turned there were shops and places to eat. I found the hotel to be really central for all my needs. If you want to be near everything then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip, just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: arif_a786
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business trips, twice. Great location, great rooms. Very reasonable prices too. Would stay nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for a bargain”
Reviews.Author: GabrielaM2
Reviews.Content: After looking into a handful of hotels in San Francisco, comparing reviews and prices, we decided to book our stay at the Hotel Abri. We were a little suspicious because of the bargain price compared to other hotels in the area and because we stayed there around New Year's. We were delighted when we got there and we found a charming hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable bed and overall a very nice, clean bedroom. Our bedroom faced Ellis St and was a little noisy early in the night, so I would recommend asking for an inner bedroom if you're planning on sleeping early.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: mellyallen
Reviews.Content: A perfect little hotel in a perfect location! Staff were friendly and helpful, especially the man working the door, cannot remember his name! The connected restaurant had great food! The location is amazing for shopping as union square and westfield are within minute walks. Also the cable car is right down the st. Massive room with an extra lounge room area, two TVA two couches and a small dining table made for a homely feel while being so relaxing and luxurious! The only downfall was our room looked into the courtyard, make for dull lighting constantly, was a bit of a downer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodeatersa
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a great location. The staff at the hotel go beyond the call of duty to be helpful. The rooms are small but very well equipped. The beds are very comfortable. This hotel is a real gem and I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Helpful Friendly Staff, decent price”
Reviews.Author: jlb1979NorCal
Reviews.Content: My family and I (two kids under 5) stayed the night at Hotel Abri last weekend and were very impressed with our experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room (an urban suite)was clean, nicely decorated and spacious. Price was good ($129) and location is close to union square and market street with easy access to BART & street cars / cable cars. We parked for the night and used public transit the rest of the time. The only improvement would be to lower the $35 (plus tax) valet parking fee. But since we parked for ~ 22 hours it isn't terrible. We were able to check out in the morning but didn't return to pickup our car until the afternoon without any additional charges. We don't live far from San Francisco, but next time we want to stay the night we will definitely be contacting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: unworldlytraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on Christmas night and were happy with the accomodations. We had a queen size bed and LOTS of luggage, so the room was a bit cramped, but we made do. Bedroom and bathroom were spotless and the front desk staff (especially Rebecca) were SO friendly and helpful. They had prepared a list of restaurants that were open for lunch and dinner on Christmas day, which was awesome. The only complaint I had was that the hotel itself was noisy - not street traffic, but other guests. It sounded like someone above us was moving furniture! We didn't do alot of exploring, as it was a quick trip, so I can't comment much on the location, but it was a quick walk to several restaurants and bars. Several homeless people in the area, some were quite aggressive, but I never felt unsafe. Overall a good hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Our Getaway”
Reviews.Author: yvette r
Reviews.Content: This is very comfortable place with nice ammenities. The front desk knowledgeable and location central to all shopping, parking a bit pricey room clean and spacious. I wold definitely recommend, cost value good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay in SF/Union Square”
Reviews.Author: questo
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day after Christmas at 7:00 AM in order to be at the stores for the after Christmas sales. Even though I knew check-in wasn't until afternoon, I took a chance and asked the staff if it would be possible to check in early. My request was granted and we were able to drop off our luggage in our room and then hit the stores for the sales. The room was an interior Jr. Suite which I was able to get through Hotels.com for a great rate. The suite consisted of a small living room w/ a sofa bed, lounge chair, desk w/ chair and a small table to eat meals at, should you choose. There is also a small refrigerator and coffee maker for coffee and tea. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, chair, chest of drawers and a roomy closet. Two robes were hanging in the closet for guests to use. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of room to store personal items. The room was very quiet because it was an interior room. I would recommend this as opposed to a room facing the street. I have stayed in this area on previous visits at other hotels that had rooms facing the street. The noise can be very overwhelming, especially in older hotels. There was complementary coffee in the lobby downstairs along w/ local newspapers. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel is very good. I did not eat there on this visit, but I have eaten there before and the food was good. After shopping and a nice lunch, we headed back to our hotel room for a little R&R. We popped in a DVD and kicked back and watched a movie. After watching the movie, we headed out again for a little more shopping and brought back dinner which we were able to enjoy in our room in peace and quiet. I would definitely stay here again as the location is a 5 minute walk from Union Square and there is tons of great shopping right outside the hotel. If you are a tourist, the cable car is around the block and BART is a block and a half.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: daFraR
Reviews.Content: The hotelt is close to the main places: cable car, subway, shops: you can go by walk everywhere. The personnel is nice and friendly, the room is clean, comfortable and nice. If you have some problem to sleep, you have only to ask to have a room not in the front of the street because during the weekend there is a local where the people go to dance; we were so tired that we didn't have any problem about it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: JTHEMUSE
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - everything you want within reach. Short stroll from Powell St Bart (station reached direct from airport) and tourist office where you can get a three day transport pass for $21 (- this was superb value). Excellent room on inner courtyard which was quiet and had very good blackout curtains. Hotel was very clean and staff helpful. Did a great deal of research before booking and would instantly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Lillieben
Reviews.Content: At our arrival we were a bit scared as to what was ahead for us. The gentleman at the reception was sleeping. He kept repeating himself and well just seemed a little out if it. Fortunately, other than this our experience at the Abri Hotel was great. Beautiful hotel located about 5 minutes from Union Square. The city trolley is also 5 minutes away and it takes you to the port where you can see Alcatraz, walk 5 minutes from there to Fishermen's Wharf to enjoy some seafood. Hotel is clean, good price, great location and overall a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price in the Heart of it All”
Reviews.Author: Richard N
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel. The room, staff and location were all excellent. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: KeanCH_11
Reviews.Content: I had difficult time finding the right hotel in SF. We decided on Abri based on the reviews. Turned out the location was perfect! Our first room was facing the street so it was noisy, they changed us to the inner facing room which was perfect. Bedding, ammenities was up to 5 star standard. Front desk service was excellent too! Overall a great experience. I would certainly recommend and come back here

Reviews.Title: “close to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: mamecchi
Reviews.Content: If you are a light sleeper, don't forget to ask "not facing Ellis St. " Anyway, ear plugs and eye mask were set in the room... The staffs were helpful when I asked to have my room change due to the street noise. Unfortunately, very close to the elevator sometimes annoyed me... the walls are not thick enough to cut the people talking at the midnight, seemed the next door had a party with music. Location, location, location! This property is convenient to BART, muni, F-line to fisherman's wharf, of course cable cars and for shopping. 1 king room felt a bit smaller than I thought. not so much space to open the suit case. Free wi-fi is weak (stressful...) Room was classic as other traditional hotels in SF. shower booth was clean with Loccitane bath amenities. If you stay weekend, visit Glide church on sunday either at 9a.m. or 11a.m. for Sunday celebration (famous for Gospel music) located on Ellis and Taylor St. (just 2 blocks away) Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, noisy and unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: drpj1967
Reviews.Content: It is midnight, you are after a day-long journey, standing in front of a reception desk. The receptionist shouts in the phone "Cut it off, idiot!" and explains that he is sick and tired of the phone ringing continously. Of course he could not find your reservation, the room he offers first turns out to be already occupied... (almost as it happened in a previous review of another guest, see other reviews) After 40 minutes of struggle the actual "suite" is cold and noisy, the window aircon heater is loud as hell. Apart from the mentally challenged night receptionist and the less than average room they charged the room price twice on my credit card... Still waiting for the solution of this problem. On the plus side is the absolute central location, which also contributes to the noise issue: see bellringing on cable-cars. For this amount of money it was definitily a terrible experience, I will surely try to avoid it in the future. (NB: the hotel was booked by my company, and I did not check the reviews beforehand... It was a mistake!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, ideal location and friendly staffs.”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1024
Reviews.Content: My first time with this hotel was in 2009 with my friend. We got the upgrade to the suite with one bedroom and one sofa bed. Very nice hotel I have to say. I like the design the the price was very affordable....but the price is much higher now...But this hotel is the only hotel I would stayed in San Francisco. And the italian restaurant downstairs is also very nice.....

Reviews.Title: “Check in nightmare, good location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ktmMendocino
Reviews.Content: Ok when you book a "regular" room through their web site they then give you an option to upgrade if available at a lesser fee then booking it at the time of booking, I opted for this option. We got a great rate for a king room. Check in was very slow, then I asked if there was an upgrade available, he kindly accommodated when I signed the paperwork there was no extra charge.... We get up to the room walk in and there is someone stuff on the bed, we quickly got out of the room not knowing if they were in the bathroom... As we are walking out of the hallway the man who checked us in came running up the stairs, we told him there is someone in the room, we got shushed like "keep quiet so they can't hear us" and he also made us feel like somehow it was our fault. We go back down to the lobby..Ok this is all after many detours in the city from road work, we wait, we wait some more. Ok They have another room for us, we asked if it was a suite and were told no, we were not paying for one and he should not have put us in one, what??? I was not trying to get on for free.... So we got to our room and it was directly across from a very busy bar/lounge on the Saturday night before Halloween, the air was stale and the window would not open. So we went from one of the nicest rooms to the dog of a room.. After my day so far I was just happy to be settled and didn't want to go downstairs and change rooms again... The beds are very comfortable and the room blacks out nicely. I have stayed here before and enjoyed myself. The location is great..... I am not sure if I will be staying here again, I know my husband wont.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RachelPrinceton_NJ
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and needed a hotel close to the BART. I enjoy staying at boutique hotels rather than large corporate hotels so Hotel Abri was an obvious choice. The location is fantastic. Close to shopping and the BART and the Powell Cable Car line. I was a bit worried about the street noise mentioned in other reviews so I requested a room on an upper floor. I got a room on the inside 5th floor. The room was very comfortable and I heard NO noise from the street. While I would not call the room spacious, it was comparable to other city hotel rooms. I will definitely stay again when I have to be in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: gtwdesigns
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful and accommodating. The location is very close to public transportation. The suite layout was great for us with our toddler, and they had a pack and play for us to use. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Abri!”
Reviews.Author: splow25
Reviews.Content: I arrived in San Francisco on Friday night for the Halloween weekend, and i wanted to stay at Abri Hotel again since it was my 1st choice for accommodation due to reasons I mentioned earlier in my 2010 review. I wanted to experience the SF Halloween festivity and madness, and to do shopping at Union Square shops which are just steps away from this hotel! The hotel check in was very smooth and efficient with the friendly front desk, Ms. Calle. And there was a special welcome drink too, to start the evening right! My room was on the 5th floor; so, I had no need to use the earplugs at all. And the bed was sumptuous indeed! Checking out was also very efficient with affable Ms. Rebecca. Would I stay at Abri again? Yes, I will indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmm...”
Reviews.Author: dahlia8
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Abri because my daughter and her friend were attending a concert 3 blocks away. PROS: So convenient to the cable cars, Union Square, shopping and nightlife, very friendly staff, reasonable rates for San Francisco, refrigerator in room, coffee maker in room, 2 tv's in the Urban Suite, free wi-fi. CONS: Panhandlers greet you as you enter the hotel, long waits for your car when you valet, very noisy due to the club across the street, urban suite = no phone next to the bed thus you must leap out of bed and run to the other room if it rings, musty smelling room. Although it seemed like it would be a hip hotel, it ended up feeling old and run down.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy”
Reviews.Author: ErnestTito
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in a good location. But don't go there to sleep. We had a bedroom in front of a night club on Ellis Street and it was a mess all the night. The hotel knows the problem and we found earplugs on the night stand when we arrived. Moreover, it's quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - best for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrl09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Abri for 4 nights in October. The staff was very nice, the rooms were clean and quiet. I was offered an inside room and I think this was a good choice as the outside noise may have been distracting. I would recommend this hotel for tourists in particular - it's a boutique hotel with nice comfy beds, new TVs, nice bathrooms, etc. but the rooms themselves are smaller and more ideal for those who would be spending much of their time in San Fran outside of the hotel. As a business traveler, I felt a bit claustrophobic in the room during the day. Also, the Italian restaurant attached is very good, but I did not feel like Italian food 3 times a day so I went out to Starbucks and the surrounding places for something different. Also, there is no gym in-house. Lastly, there are homeless people who linger out front (and one got a little too close for my own comfort - I lived in NYC for 7 years and never experienced this) but that was the only real blimp. The area is great for shopping, exploring, and seeing the sights in SF. Again, a great choice for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Ice M
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown San Fran this hotel is a gem. The rooms are cozy small for sure but the beds are comfy and the bathroom clean. Bathroom stocked with L'occitane products - a nice touch there. Nice Italian restaurant connected to hotel. The major subway station is 3 mins away..breakfast/lunch/dinner all within walking distance with so much to choose. Cold stone creamery Ice Cream right next door! Try Lefty O'Dooles for breakfast - up the street, a tiny coffee stop right across the street on the left makes great bagels for budget breakfast. Do not forget to vsit Farmers market - on Sat it is bustling with vendors for food and artists with cool knick knacks and paintings. Make sure you try ROLLI ROTI....in Farmers mkt.. pork sandwich to die for/ rosemary chicken will make your day. Book these tours through Viator.com - 1. Napa/Sonoma Wine tour 2. Alcatraz Prison- night tour if possible 3. Muir Woods.....you need more time here..they only gave us an hour is it truly is a great place to take in. 4. California Museum of Science a great entertaining experience. Getting around is a breeze...hotel is in such a great location and is perfect for a good nights rest for a fun filled days.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Abri!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: Great location, close enough to everything and still quiet. We were at a conference at the Mascone Center, it is quick walk to there. The room was very comfortable, the bed was great and I love the bathrobes! The staff were very attentive and freindly making us feel like we were at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: matyovis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location near union square. The room that I ordered was not available at the time I checked-in so I got an upgrade to the suite with large bathroom, coffee maker, 2 large flat screens, a small office. All the rooms have a complimentary WIFI with no extra charge, at the lobby their is also a printer if needed. The stuff was very helpfull and very very nice. Every evening they serve a small non-alcoholic cocktail to the guests at the lobby. They are very helpfull with transportations, atractions and everything else you ask for. The room was very clean. The only thing that good be better is the view from my window that was to the patio and you can see and be seen by your neighbours. I certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Chawin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, it was a great place to stay at. Very good locations. Their is bus coming to pick up, but the rooms is not so big and i am not sure if pets are allowed or not. I am also not sure if their is connecting rooms. It was a really nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon621
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Sq. Room was large well appointed with coffee maker and large flat screen TV. Large bathroom with storage and walk in shower Hotel staff were very helpful. Great restaurant next door with access through hotel lobby.Great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NZGrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a 1 bedroom suite overlooking an internal courtyard. Rather dated brown decor but with an excellent bed and shower and very quiet. There was a strong chemical smell in the hall and room on arrival that lingered for 3 days, maybe pesticide spraying. The staff were excellent and the location fantastic. It is between the Powell St Bart station and Union Square, just along from the Powell St cable car station so hard to beat. The room was expensive but similar to other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hccpsu
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Abri at the end of our Napa Valley trip. Friendly staff and attractive lobby, and the location was very good, too. The room was quite nice, but tiny--same with the bathroom. The space between the toilet and the wall was so tight that in the middle of the night my husband whacked his nose on the towel bar when he went to sit down on the toilet. From other reviews it appears exterior rooms might be a bit larger, so it might be a toss-up between quiet and space. We liked the room, but more than one night would have been difficult because there wasn't any space to unpack. We ate at Puccini and Pinetti, the Italian restaurant connected to the hotel, and enjoyed our meal very much.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want SFO”
Reviews.Author: dvlnsyd
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little boutique hotel does a fabulous job of making every aspect of your stay wonderful. This hotel was such a fabulous surprise. The customer service was outstanding. From the first moment we pulled up the staff was amazing. The rooms were small but very comfortable. The staff smiled and greeted us everytime we came and went and met our every need. Our room faced Ellis Street allowing us to watch the activity on the street. We were on the second floor so the actvity on the street could be a bit loud at times. But not enough to discourage us from staying again. We truly enjoyed our stay and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Wellington31
Reviews.Content: We were delighted when we arrived at Hotel Abri. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The lobby and public areas were chic and well maintained. Most importantly, the bed's are extremely lush and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Visit”
Reviews.Author: Sharon C
Reviews.Content: We took a chance on this property reading other reviews on sites and it more than exceeded our expectations. From the casual lobby and friendly staff who always were ready to help us figure out the best way to get to our destination to the enjoyable refreshments offered to guests in the early evening it is a hotel I would highly recommend. The room was small but all that mattered was there. The bed was extra comfy and the amenities in the bathroom were top drawer. The location is supreme! We took the BART into town and were within blocks of all other public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “The heart lof San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Ellamc
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and accomidati nghotel and staff. The staff always helped and gave us information on places to visit/eat/shop. The were kind and layed-back. We travelled as a family and the only option for a single room was to have two people share a sofa-bed, however we eventually worked out a way to make everyone comfortable. It was an amazing location, although it wasn't close to the bay, there was a tram very close that took us right to the piers, also in a prime location for fantasic and affordable food and shopping. We thought the Wi-Fi was quite quick. Also a very clean hotel with modern and nice design, good sized bathroom. We had a fantastic experience and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: BJinBowie
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but had a very enjoyable stay. Received a comped stay here after being accidentally bumped from my original reservation at the Larkspur at Union Square. Tip: Make sure you double confirm before you arrive. Anyway, Art at the Larkspur arranged a room for me here and even managed to get me to smile before I left for Hotel Abri. Tyler most graciously greeted me when I arrived still seething from the fiasco. Did I mention it was almost 10 pm when I arrived? I was quickly given a room and settled in for the evening. The rooms are admittedly quite small however very functional and modern. Very clean and I'm a stickler for that. Huge plasma TV in the room and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on in a long time. The only downside is that if you're on the street side of the hotel, you WILL hear some noise late into the evening since there is a nightclub directly across the street. No different than being in downtown Manhattan..So if that 's not your cup of tea, then ask for an inner room. Otherwise you're convenient to everything including B.A.R.T which will take you to the SFO airport for $8.10. Can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of Europe...”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 3 nights at Hotel Abri, and was very pleased with the overall experience! The rooms reminded me of a European hotel (including no space around the sink for toiletries), European styling in the lobby and elevator - made me remember back to many fond memories of trips to Europe. As other people mentioned, there was a unique fragrance in the hallway (much less so in the room), although I didn't mind it at all (even though I'm typically sensitive to perfumes). My room faced Ellis Street, and there was a LOT of street noise at night, but I'm a very heavy sleeper, so I only noticed it a little bit and it didn't bother me at all. The staff was SO nice and the adjoining restaurant was fabulous. It's also in a great location, next to the Powell St. cable car turnaround and between Union Square and the Moscone Center. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Fransisco”
Reviews.Author: Mojo707
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and of all the hotels we stayed in our month long vacation in the US (which included New York, DC, Vegas, and San Fran) the Abri staff were by far the friendliest and most helpful. The hotel is in a great location only a few minutes walk from shopping restraunts and tram lines and has clean comfirtable and modern rooms with large LCD tv free wifi and charging for iphones.

Reviews.Title: “Fare price, veryy nice, will return”
Reviews.Author: retiredCDF
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel a minute or two from the theater district, union square, cable car, BART, Muni, buses, and street cars. Looks like the hotel has been remodeled recently. Out side rooms are a bit larger than the center rooms but larger. the center rooms are super quiet. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco mix at the Abri”
Reviews.Author: Harradexperience
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at this Larkspur hotel. Staff and lobby upscale and delightful, but the rooms are a bit of a disappointment. Clean and newly decorated, they can be an odd shape and the dusty smell offputting. One should also be aware that, although the hotel is right in the center of all that's happening in the city, it abuts the Tenderloin which is a sketchy part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdog13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located - close to shops, restaurants and public transport system. It's easily reachable by public transport from the airport. Room was clean and well equipped (the flat screen was huge). Little noisy at night, which is not surprising, it's on a rush street. To avoid noise ask for room facing to the courtyard. Internet was free of charge and worked O.K. Staff is fine, all were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but no concierge”
Reviews.Author: ljkogelnik
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is located in the heart of Union Square, close to public transportation (if using the BART to travel to/from the airport, get off at Powell – only $8.10 pp). Because we stayed 6 days and traveled to San Francisco to celebrate our anniversary, the hotel generously upgraded our room to a suite and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. Overall, our room was comfortable, clean and quiet (having requested a room away from the street). I also appreciated the complimentary coffee every morning, free Internet access/newspaper and high quality toiletries. My only disappointment with the hotel was the lack of a concierge. Though the front desk staff was extremely kind and did their best to help us when we had questions or asked for restaurant recommendations, they often gave us misinformation. Certainly, you can do research on your own before and during the trip (as we did), but it certainly helps to have someone on the staff who answers specific questions correctly and offers suggestions for places to eat and things to do. In fact, we met someone in Mill Valley who recently stayed at another Larkspur hotel in Union Square and said the same thing – though the hotel was very nice, he felt the staff wasn’t helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AverageGuyAlberta
Reviews.Content: Advice, ask for a room off the street side. It is very noisy at night. It takes a while to get hot water in the room with the low water pressure. Great Staff always helpfull. Bed was very comfortable. It is at a very good location for shopping, restaurants, transportation. I would go back but would ask for a diffrent room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: iamjoey
Reviews.Content: the staff was very friendly. the hotel was very clean. the location was perfect for us. it's so close to union square which has tons of shopping and restaurants. the cable cars were just around the corner as was the powell muni station which made getting around a piece of cake. i'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: speechgirl4
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel to stay in Union Square area of San Francisco. It is close to everything-shopping, restaurants, tourtist areas, etc. The rooms are small but very clean. The staff is exceptional. They are friendly and helpful. They seem to know the answers to any question about the city. This is the second time I have stayed there and will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: spuds000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean an staff very very friendly. As we stayed 5 nights we were provided with an upgrade upon arrival. We were very impressed with this. We had a very enjoyable stay in a suite with separate living area with 40'' tv and a spatious bedroom with yet another 40'' tv! Very enjoyable stay, we would highly recommend this hotel - also very luxorious complimentary toiletries. Compliementry usage of computers with internet in lobby area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Friendly staff. Noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: Tom2121
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable but small. The window doesn't close for real so it's really noisy at night. Very clean. The bed is great. Bathroom also clean. Very nice shower. The location is perfect ! The cablecar and the shops are just across the street. The valet parking is too expensive and there's a strange smell (a good one but unusual) in the hotel. But the staff is really cool and the design is nice and modern. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: snoopy79
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Hotel Abri! From the moment we arrived the staff could not be more helpful. The staff always made a point to say good morning etc, they were always cheerful. We had requested a quiet room and I've got to say I didn't hear a thing! The room was gorgeous and was beautifully decorated. It included everything you need from bath robes to L’Occitane toiletries - and the free wi-fi was a lovely bonus. The hotel is in an excellent location. At the end of the street you can find the trolley stop and you are a very short walk away from Union Square, Market St, etc. We actually walked to Fisherman's Wharf. It takes about 25-35 mins but it really is a lovely walk. If I return to San Francisco then I would definitely stay at the Hotel Abri. Really impressed!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: WheelsUp!
Reviews.Content: Amazingly helpful staff. Unbeatable location. Reasonably priced boutique hotel. Try to get a newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: simranb
Reviews.Content: the hotel satff is very courteous and helpful. the call centre executive was kind enough to remind us of our AAA membership [which we had] and gave us a discount. the rooms are smallish but very clean and nice. the toiletries are Loccitane which adds a nice luxurious touch. plus the location is a great plus !! all in all , i would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: keithgoff
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room in a lovely hotel, booked extremely last minute due to a disaster with another hotel. Very friendly staff, the adjoining bar didn't stay open late was the only problem.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: rags60
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a wedding in June. I also asked for the "quiet" side, seeing that I am a light sleeper. They fully met that request and also upgraded us to the suite. Beautiful room! So much space and for the rate these rooms were very good..clean, perfect location, great service. Love the little amenities like the organic coffee and happy hour fruity free drink. I would highly recommed and also very close to Bart (easy to ride to airport also).

Reviews.Title: “Nice feel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: maj2155
Reviews.Content: Was looking for something in the Union Square area close to stuff to do and transportation. I normally go for the trusty chains but hotels.com had a sale on Hotel Abri and the reviews sounded pretty good overall vs. the chains. The location was excellent. Close to public transportation, food and shopping. SF is pretty easy to get around and the hotel staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. The rooms were tastefully decorated, nice big flat screen tvs and a super comfy bed! We had the jr urban suite which I would totally recommend for 2+ people as the regular rooms looked a little small. The suite had a separate living room area with fridge and TV. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom door which was like a privacy glass but you could see the person moving around from the bedroom. There was definitely noise from the street but it didn't bother me personally. I also liked the free internet- that is a savings over the chains. The only con was no breakfast option although there is an attached restaurant so I guess that solves that. We walked to the nearby City Diner so it was fine. I really enjoyed the stay. Another bonus was the staff accomodated a late 2pm check-out for us(at no charge) so that was really great. More time to rest in their cozy beds. They also stored our bags for free after we checked out so we could roam around until our flight. As long as you aren't looking for big space, can handle a few street sounds and aren't embarassed knowing your partner can see if you are on the toilet (we all do it...haha), Hotel Abri is a really nice find!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jellona
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just a couple of blocks from the Union Square. The bus from the Oakland Amtrak station also has a stop just a block or so away. Rental car agencies are also just behind corner... And a lot of shops around... The rooms and corridors were clean. Our first room was very big, but unfortunately it was on the first floor and there was a nightclub just on the other side of the street. The noisy crowd hanging around the nightclub kept loud noise until late Friday night and it was quite hard to fall asleep... I went to the reception to ask for quieter room, but I was said that the hotel is full and they can't do that immediately. Next day, however, our luggage was moved to another, quiet room (the view from the window was toward inner courtyard). The new room was unfortunately a lot smaller... It was a very good choice mainly due to the central location and overall cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 out fo 5 for me. Here's why.”
Reviews.Author: Djibuddha
Reviews.Content: I always have a free bed in SF, so paying for a hotel bed seems odd, but I was here on business. If you've already committed to spend SF hotel money to stay near attractions, this isn't a bad spend. Pros: location - the Powell St. cable car ends two blocks away from you on the opposite corner of the block of buildings you would be in. Theaters and museums are mere blocks away. Bed - my goodness was this bed comfortable. I don't sleep well on most hotel mattresses, but I did here - which is good because I was here for a week! Wifi - complimentary and pretty good from my room. They have accessible rooms - which oddly enough I got, though I don't need it. Refrigerator in the room! Victory for me. I have medical needs for one, hate shelling out extra, and it is also convenient for keeping fresh fruit and other items cool so I don't have to shell out for the overpriced, less-than-great breakfasts nearby. Individual climate control - it does actually get hot in SF on occasion. The air conditioning did its job. Cons: location - there is a nightclub across the street and these windows don't appear to be double-glazed! They DO have ear plugs in the rooms and I was asked at check in if I needed a street-side or interior room. I was not facing the nightclub, but still got noise when the restaurant downstairs took out the trash at late/early hours. Age. This property IS renovated, but its age shows in spots, like in the wiring that's on the wall instead of behind it and closets that are ridiculously small. Air conditioning is by unit in the window. Some people don't like this (I do). Housekeeping: they didn't seem to want to replace things in the bathroom (i.e. washcloths, not soap) and the toilets are dual flush. Even full flush doesn't... um... always do the job. Ahem. Also, the panhandlers will be waiting for you. Don't head west on some of the nearby streets (esp Eddy). That is the Tenderloin. If you are looking for what the Tenderloin has to offer, well, then go ahead. The list of cons is longer, but I find fault easily - take it for what its worth. There is a popular restaurant attached to the hotel. I did not eat there (spendy), but it attracted a solid crowd in a neighborhood with a lot of competition. There are, of course, a ton of delicious places nearby and it is also around the same corner to the Powell St. Muni/Bart stations. If I came to SF for business again, I would consider staying here eventhough my worksite was not nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Anna0138
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and I can highly recommend it. Even though the rooms are quite small, the location is perfect- a 2 minute walk from the cable car station. Staff is really friendly and helpful. Valet parking is offered for about 40 dollars/day. The bathroom is equipped with L'OCCITANE products and there is free wifi in every room. Previous reviews have mentioned the noise from outside. We had a room facing the street and the noise didn't bother us at all. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, clean, convenient, reasonably hip”
Reviews.Author: troubler
Reviews.Content: Cute suits & sneakers outfits on the staff and the front desk! Very cheerful housekeeping folks (I hope they're union &/or paid well with good bennies & pensions!). Very comfortable beds with heaps of pillows. A good amount of space in the bathroom and bedroom. Location is extremely convenient. They offered a choice between a room on the street and a quiet room. The quiet room was very quiet indeed. Nice quality bath supplies, although they didn't always replace stuff when I used it up. Towels definitely fluffy, and I liked the bathrobes they provided. Only weak spots were TV (few channels, not great reception) and the wireless, although free (a must in any reasonable hotel) it is spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: copekids
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and the staff was polite. My only complaint is that the bathroom was so small and inconvenient for getting ready in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tritonkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and I have to say that this was a great place to stay. The room was large, the bed very comfortable and the location was ideal for us. Our only complaint was the noise from outside the hotel made by workmen repairing the road. Take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Staff in the hotel were invariably polite and well mannered. We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dhanson358
Reviews.Content: I came into town for a one week conference at the Moscone center. Comparing with everyone else I talked to, I am confident I found the best combination of value and service in the area! The staff was very friendly (even had a room for me when I showed up an hour before checkin) and always helpful. The rooms are not huge (welcome to the city!), but are quite comfortable and very well appointed. Everything has a very clean, modern feel. Many of my fellow conference goers were paying MORE money in the same neighborhood for small, dingy, sketchy feeling hotels. One even stayed in a hotel that had a hostel-style arrangement with a community bathroom...and I was only paying $50 more a night for the luxury of the Abri! I wouldn't necessarily say this is the best part of town if you are coming for tourism, but it is only about a 5-8 minute walk to Moscone / Yerba Buena, so I would definitely recommend this for anyone heading there. One last thing, Free Wifi! Many of the bigger chains STILL want you to pay $15-$25 a day for Internet. It's free at Abri, and the speed was quite good. If you are a business traveler (or just someone who really wants their Wifi), remember to factor this in when making cost decisions.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: seldeleon
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel was amazing! i called at 8am to see if i can check in early and i was told that they have a room available so i can check in early. checked in at 9am, i'm very thankful. free upgrade from queen bed to king bed was also provided for free. the bed was very comfortable and there's a DVD player provided which was a real plus!!! the staff was very friendly and helpful. i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: STB3288
Reviews.Content: We came into the city to celebrate our 25th Anniversary and stayed at the Hotel Abri. We both thought it was wonderful! Great location, great room, fantastic service with attention to detail!

Reviews.Title: “There is no noise insulation in rooms backing onto Ellis street”
Reviews.Author: Bufdyoli
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room backing onto busy street. A night club went in until about 2.30am. Every word could be heard due to poor double glazing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deedee8511
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as part of our honeymoon trip, we'd been to Vegas, LA and on a cruise. It was the final part of the holiday. It doesn't look much from the street, but the location is amazing, and the foyer is lovely. Jonathon checked us in and he was very well informed and helpful. We went up to our room which had been upgraded as we were on honeymoon, to a suite on the top floor. The suite was outstanding, very comfortable living room area, and a huge bed which again was fabulous. A moment later there was a knock on the door and we were sent up some wine and chocolates. It was our first visit to San Francisco and the staff were very knowledgable about the area and transport links to get us where we wanted to go. We loved hotel Abri and would definately stay there again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “FAB HOTEL- PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lilglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Absolutley loved the Hotel Abri. We got a great deal on Expedia and booked after reading the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. When checking in we were told that as a better room was available we had been upgraded :) Our room was fab. The bed was soooo comfortable and the room had more ammenities than I expected (fresh coffee filter, huge flatscreen tv with cable, ipod docking station and radio, iron and board, safe, air con). The bathroom was also very large and the L'Octtaine products were a lovely touch. The free Wi-fi was great. We had a street facing room so there was some noise but it really didnt affect us...even on the Saturday night when the nightclub opposite was open! You couldnt get a better location at union square- right around the corner is the cable car turnaround and the streetcar/ bus pick up. Staff were also very pleasant. Will definetley be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abri: A hotel that knows how things are done.”
Reviews.Author: TalkingTravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abri proves an exquisite establishment. Everything about this hotel, from its prime location, to the intricate detailing and personal service, assure an exclusive experience of comfort and satisfaction. This hotel is completely and unpretentiously classy. It is an establishment knowingly providing personalised service and comfort to all guests. The Hotel Abri has been awarded a three and a half star rating, however this is indeed no reflection on the level of comfort and service provided, from check-in to check-out, and at all times between. When making a reservation, I often contact the hotel prior to my stay in order to make requests, ranging from high floor to quiet room location. On this occasion, my request was for the both of these, and I was very surprised to have been provided with a room that met these criteria. Check in was immediate, with no line to wait in. I was courteously checked in to my room by Tyler, who greeted me and offered his services during my stay. As mentioned, all members of staff are personable, and very approachable. I only had one other encounter with a member of staff: Jonathan, who followed through with my request almost immediately, and followed up with a call to ensure my request was taken care of. A few things worth noting are that the rooms are quite small, however this is commonplace in San Francisco, particularly the rooms being that of an older building. That being said, the room has been designed well, and there is sufficient room to move about as freely as required. Other (very minor and petty) points worth mentioning are that the showerhead was positioned at an uncomfortable angle, and the coffee was not replenished for the coffee machine throughout my entire four night stay. The lifts were also a little slow, but none of these points bothered me at all, really. It just may be worth mentioning for the benefit of others. I am not difficult to please, however when reviewing hotels, I always offer the rating that I would provide the hotel as an official rating. This hotel comes very close to the full five stars (I would award four and a half stars, given the opportunity, however this is not possible), even considering the fact that there lacks services common to establishments of such rating, such as a gym, spa or 24 hour room service. This is possibly as close to the full five stars that I have ever been, and this is comparing a three and a half star hotel, to many hotels that have been awarded a five star rating. It is for this reason that I will only choose The Hotel Abri when venturing to San Francisco. This way, I can be guaranteed a comfortable and unique experience; not simply a “stay”.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and full of luxurious ammenities”
Reviews.Author: chicago2socal
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to a Larkspur hotel in San Francisco and the Abri. I was looking for a boutique hotel near Moscone, but did not want to stay at a mainstream hotel brand. The Abri was absolutely perfect for a lux traveler like myself. My room was small, but quite comfortable. The linens, duvet, towels, L'Occitane products, gourmet coffee and teas made me smile. The free wireless internet service was strong - even on a high floor room like mine. The air-conditioner was quiet and the alarm clock radio has an iPod connection. The flat screen TV is large and has many cable channels for late night viewing. The evening refreshment was a nice surprise after a long day at the convention center. Hotel doorman and front desk staff were always welcoming. Here's a good Idea: They offer a town car to the airport for about the same price as a taxi-very nice way to end your stay. Ask about it as it is not advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryfromoakville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Abri for 5 nights while attending a convention at the Moscone Center. The hotel is a small, boutique style hotel, superbly located. The Moscone Center was about a 10 minute walk away for me, while Macy's, Bloomingdales, Barney's, Nordstrom and the Disney Store took me about 5 minutes to get to. A few great breakfast and lunch spots were located a couple of minutes walk away from the hotel - but some were a bit pricey. Tours will pick you up as this hotel, which was much appreciated. Although Bay to Breakers took place during my stay, my room was quiet and I received a great sleep each night. I had a King room, which overlooked the courtyard. The King room has a really comfortable bed, a large bathroom, and a good size office area. A supply of l"Occitaine toiletries was products provided through out my stay. There is a coffee maker, with coffee supplied in the room. I especially appreciated the friendly and great service I received throughout my stay. Thank you Wilmer and Edwin, especially, for your cheerfulness and helpfulness every day! I booked my room via Booking.com and paid less than $200 including taxes for the King Room. Free internet was included, as was complimentary coffee and tea throughout the morning in the lobby. There are also a couple of computers in the lobby, in case you haven't brought yours along. Although San Francisco was extremely busy and bustling throughout my stay, I found the Hotel Abri to be a quiet and peaceful oasis to return to each day.

Reviews.Title: “Small, intimate and very convenient to all anemities in the city”
Reviews.Author: KrishnaS3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful "green" hotel. Very old building renovated beautifully. Extremely clean and neat.. Rooms are small and have lots of storage, but no fridge. We used the ice bucket to cool yogurt and milk which worked very well. The bathroom has a shower only (can hold two people) and is very satisfying. Bed is extremely comfortable. Location is perfect - close to the subway and Union Square. Everything I needed is within walking distance, even the tour bus. Make sure you ask for a quiet room. The other side of the hotel overlooks the main street which is very noisy. The staff asked if we wanted a quiet or noisy room. They provide earplugs if you are in a noisy room and it bothers you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my needs!”
Reviews.Author: DanForsley
Reviews.Content: Five night stay in early May 2011. Not being an overly critical guest after staying in hotels for well over fifty years, I found the Abri very acceptable. I personally want a friendly front desk above other needs such as luxurious neighborhood. I also love housekeeping that shows up as soon as you put that little notice on the door. This is a big winner for me every time! The Abri fit all my requirements as to location, cleanliness, and room function. Upon checking in I was advised that if the street noise was a problem I could change to a rear facing room. Although the street facing room was much larger, I decided that the garbage collection trucks at 3:30 AM did not work for me. My new room was perfect: but small. If you want to be in the heart of things (many do not) this is the place to stay, especially if you are on a limited hotel budget. I like city buzz and a quick walk to 24 hour bacon and eggs if the mood strikes. Be advised that San Francisco has a generous population of people who's main source of living is asking passers by for handouts. Know this in advance and try to go with that bit of SF "color". This city is one of the most beautiful on the planet so also be prepared for that if you have not been here before. Bring a warm jacket no matter the time of year you arrive. Check out what Mark Twain had to say about that. He was not joking. But as to the front desk and the friendly daily greetings of the staff: the Abri will keep bringing me back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A 3.5 Star With a 5 Star Location”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieab
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel four 4 nights this past April due to it's high ratings on TripAdvisor. I frequent San Francisco a few times every couple of years, so I enjoy being able to stay at different hotels, but this to me was an overall disappointment. I will start by saying that yes, the location of the hotel is great, but there are a lot of other "true" 5 star hotels that have great locations as well. The rooms themselves are quite small and had I been staying any longer, or travelling with luggage (I just had carry-on) I would have found the space to have been much too cramped. The room I received was facing the inside courtyard, so there was no obvious street noise which was nice, BUT, the rooms are not sound proofed at all! You can clearly hear doors shutting to other rooms, TV's in adjacent rooms, conversations as people passed by your door...If you're a light sleeper, good luck. The overall quality of the room wasn't much better either. It looked more like a cover up job, than a remodelling job. The door to the bathroom had chips and scratches all over it, the baseboards were cracked and had visible marks all over them, they had forgot to sand before patching something in the ceiling, the window sills were filthy and showing their age...Like I said before, not a 5 star. The front desk staff were pleasant, but had there issues as well. It is difficult to hail a cab from this particular hotel. The bellman/front desk agent actually gave up when I was trying to get a cab to go to AT&T park and referred me to the hotel across the road. I also requested a wake-up call on my last morning, and they completely forgot. When I return to San Francisco, I won't be returning to the Hotel Abri.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clhmeh
Reviews.Content: Our girls trip took us to San Francisco staying at the Abri Hotel. We were less than a block from the cable car station, bus stops, and a block from Union Square one direction and shopping in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - great!”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeetagain2
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Abri. Big room, organic coffee, quality toiletries. The location is great - just off the Powell street Bart station. Close to shopping and the Westfield Mall, heaps of restaurants int the area and close to a range of public transport. Highly recommended and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bbeitnes
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed to stay here. Close to shopping areas, close to Powell street and Cable Car. Have stayed in San Fran a couple of times before, and this was one hotel to remember.

Reviews.Title: “I expected a little bit better for our honeymoon, I guess I'm picky.”
Reviews.Author: alcsings
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and got a rental car. Very hard to navigate downtown with all the one way streets. We called from the car and got directions from a nice staff member. --The lobby staff was strange, sometimes there, sometimes in the bathroom... The lobby smelled great and is very zen. The restuarant attached is pretty good. --Our original king room was TINY and the bed had what looked like dead bug skins and human hair from an area I won't spell out.
