We notified the lobby the next day and the manager did move us to a suite and provided a bottle of excellent CA wine with a note that said congrats, very nice of them. --There is a Subway next door and you could always smell it. The hotel building itself had it's own musty sort of odor and the two smells together were sort of unpleasant. --I WILL say the toiletries (L'Occitane) were AMAZING. Their lemon verbena smell always reminds me of our honeymoon. --Really close to a cable car line and turnaround. LOTS of homeless people and their smells and the downtown area is smelly like garbage and urine :( --We ate at an amazing restuarant, Kuleto's, part of the Villa Florence hotel. Should have stayed there I guess. Next time we will stay closer to Fisherman's Warf for closer access to the Golden Gate Bridge. We spent a lot of time going north to Sonoma/Napa Valley. I will return to San Fran FOR SURE but not this hotel. (Side note: I have stayed downtown before at The Stanford Court Renaissance Hotel in Nob Hill and it was GREAT).

Reviews.Title: “Centrall located !!!”
Reviews.Author: shasidpra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night on short notice. We booked a suite as we were three adults. We found the room spacious with separate sit-out room. The hotel is dated with old furniture and fixture like wall ACs, painted teak doors etc but it is clean and well maintained. We had problems closing the main door and called the house keeping, which came in 2 minutes and set the thing right. This hotel is not for jet-set high-tech savvy traveller but for persons of cool temparament. The service is good and the reception is fast and courteous. They have valet parking but it is difficult to park your vehicle if somebody has parked their car in front of the hotel, as there is place for only one car. We had to go around twice before I got down and fetched the valet from inside !!! But, parking is a perenniel problem in San Fransisco .But be sure to keep your phone handy to seek directions from the receptionist so that you do not miss the hotel entrance while driving around the block !!! The hotel is centrally located with the Cable car starting point at Powell street nearby. There are lot of streets to amble around during the day and the locality is lively with lots of eating places and shopping centres around. There is not much view still it is better to take a room with street view. It is a family kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic!”
Reviews.Author: Julep
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly and great service. Lovely room, very confortable bed, free internet, coffee..Great location...would go there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to enjoy shopping”
Reviews.Author: Kyoncy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and my younger sister for 3days. It was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. We flew from Tokyo and were exhausted from all the things we had to experience because of the quake. Though it was still 11am or noon, they were ready for our room!!! We were sooo tired, so it made all of us so happy :) Our room, the urban suit, was surprisingly spacious for a hotel in downtown SF. Enough room for 3ppl and we really felt comfortable staying in the room. I liked how they had a door between the bedroom and the living room because I didn't need to disturb my mom's sleep while I stay up late doing internet in the living room. The room was very clean and we loved the l'occitan(am I spelling right?) soap and shampoos because they are expensive in Japan. They have complimentary wireless internet and the safe in the room was big enough to fit my 13inch size Macbook. The bed was comfortable but the sofa bed was a bit too small. Though it's in the noisy area, the room was very quiet. As other reviews say, the AC was noisy and we had to turn it off when we go to sleep though it was chilly in March. We should have asked for extra blankets. The service was really nice and helpful. Everyone was friendly. Just one thing about the front desk though...I asked them if I should make a reservation for Alcatraz tour and they said no. But, actually, it was much easier and faster if you have a reservation. It's a little thing and I think it is the only complain I have besides the sofa bed :) Overall, we really had a great stay in Hotel Abri and we will definitely stay here in the urban suit when we visit SF next time ;) Thank you very much!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Paige154914
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay in with unique decor, exceptionally friendly service, and prompt responses to room requests. It is an old style building that has been fully renovated, which I love staying in. It reminded me a bit of some of the older hotels in New York City. It has very nicely renovated rooms and bathrooms. Rooms were on the small side, but exceptionally clean and well maintained. I stayed in a room with a king size bed and a desk, which was essential for my internet connections on my laptop. The only slight downside was the low water pressure from the shower heads, and a bit of noise from the street side (the hotel faces a nightclub - Infusion Lounge - which looked very appealing but I didn't get the chance to visit this). If you want a quiet room, opt for one that does not face the street. The bed was outstanding for comfort. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is tired of the same old hotel style in all the major cities and wants to see something a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: Razasa
Reviews.Content: When you are starting a review here, maybe you stop to think, how can I put 5 stars in a small room and bath like this?. This is San Francisco. Is almost impossible to find good price, service and space in Union Square. So this is a good deal. Very good staff. They even provide umbrellas if it´s raining. There is a Restaurant, just next door, Puccini & Pinetti. DO NOT take your breakfast there. They charged me usd 65,00 (two people) for eggs and fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located.”
Reviews.Author: Bon1111
Reviews.Content: Small, nicely renovated botique-style hotel. Well situated. Friendly staff. Attractive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abri is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: wandacleo
Reviews.Content: This is a charming CLEAN hotel (with NO bedbug reports). The people who work there are so cheerful, helpful, and friendly. Free coffee and papers in the morning and free drink in the evening. The hotel is very near Union Square (and cable cars), so there are a lot of good restaurants. Easy walk to Chinatown. The rooms are small, but adequate and the bathroom is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect botique hotel in the heart of the shopping area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, cute spacious rooms, la'occitane soaps. Loved it. And i'm probably the most spoiled woman in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again & Again”
Reviews.Author: None501
Reviews.Content: I typically do not like to travel by myself, but would easily travel back to the Hotel Abri. Upon arrival I was met quickly by the staff, who attended to my every need. My room was small, but pleasant and inviting. I ordered room service; it quickly arrived and was delicious. I must say that the staff ensured my safe exursions to and from the conference hotel at which many other colleagues were staying. In fact, they were willing to tell me optional routes and modes of transporation so I could take to arrive more cheaply and quickly at my destiations. Upon one occasion, it began to rain just as I was leaving the hotel. The concierge provided me one of the hotel's umbrellas without my asking. Most places would have let me get wet. I would definately stay here again and am encouraging others to do so as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mrgAmes_IA
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Abri was pleasant in every way. We were greeted by a very friendly desk clerk upon our arrival which was during the night. He advised us that the room left for us was nice but small and it was the best he could do as the hotel was sold out for the night. He offered to move us to a bigger room the next day when there was more availability and left directions for the day staff accordingly. In the morning they called and asked if that was still our wish. Agreeing, they asked us to pack our things so that the bellman could move them when a room was cleaned and ready. The room they moved us to was on the inside of the hotel overlooking the courtyard and was spacious, quiet, and comfortable. The staff was very friendly offering help and suggestions with sightseeing, restaurants, bus accommodations, etc. There is an Italian restaurant right off the lobby and open to the street which seemed to be a very popular spot. We did not have opportunity to eat there but did check the menu which was inviting. The hotel is nicely decorated having undergone a renovation in recent years.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: DixieGirl1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 500sq ft Urban Suite on the inside of the building to avoid noise from the streets. Not much of a view, but the best night sleep after walking around all day. The curtains completely black out the room and the bed was incredibly comfortable, no saggy middle. Comfortable living area with flat screen, dinning table, and nice workstation. Large king bedroom with flat screen, IPhone dock, and lots of storage space. Large bathroom with beautiful walk in shower. Rooms are like the pictures, beautiful and clean. Staff is wonderful and helpful. Convenient to everything. Great sushi across the street. This place was a great value and I hope we can go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Whattheadam
Reviews.Content: Awesome, hip hotel right next to everything in Union Square. It's also within a few dozen steps to the Powell BART station, which was super helpful and convenient for me. Like many of the rooms in San Francisco, the rooms here were quite small... about the size of a king size bed with space to walk around the edges... but what set our room apart were the nice appointments and modern touches and amenities. There was an ipod dock, a large flat screen tv, free wifi, a small fridge, good quality toiletries and so on. The location was great, the staff were all smiles and pleasant, and the beds were comfy. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great location and chic decor.”
Reviews.Author: Candy_Kane68
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great - except for the vague musty smell in the room. The hotel is very well maintained, but because of its age, it just smelled a little "old". The furnishings, bathroom fixtures, bed and everything else were new and we soon didn't even notice the old smell after the first few minutes. Had an inside courtyard room which was very quiet, but understood from the front desk that the street noise on Friday and Saturday is usually quite loud, so if you want quiet, don't book a street-side room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for where it is and what you get”
Reviews.Author: JR-from-London
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located and in a busy area with a "European" feel, close to shops and restaurants. The welcome was friendly and the reception staff were friendly and helpful throughout our visit. The internal design is slightly old-fashioned but the rooms are fine although the desk is a bit too close to the bed for those nocturnal walks. Free internet is a bonus and a computer and printer are available at no cost in the lobby. The only drawback worth commenting on is noise - your choice is between the risk of street noise or the drone of air conditioning units if you have an inward facing room. But I would certainly stay again when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Sangle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a first class experience at the Abri Hotel. The service was second to none - everyone was so helpful and accommodating. We have stayed at several boutique hotels and this was by far the best service and value. The lobby was modern, the rooms were spacious, the bed was very comfortable, the room very quiet and the location was excellent. I simply can't say enough about the staff. Best ever! We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great bed, pretty good room”
Reviews.Author: Kate367199
Reviews.Content: The good stuff: 1) The staff were uniformly friendly, warm, and helpful. 2) Location is great. 3) Very nice lobby. 4) Very comfortable beds! 5) The window opened for fresh air. The not-as-good: 1) I had a very small room--it was designed efficiently, but really could have used at least a dresser or other place to put folded clothing. 2) The bathroom had essentially zero storage space--just a tiny shelf above the toilet. No bathrobe hook, nothin'! Some of your guests must be product addicts like me--where do you think we're supposed to put our stuff? 3) No fitness center--they will connect you with a gym 4 blocks away for $15/day. Overall: A very good value for this neighborhood in SF, wonderful staff, good but not great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: olopez79
Reviews.Content: Very nice and professional front desk staff. We arrived a bit early to check-in and our reservation was not ready yet. Rather than have us wait until the next room was made availble the front desk clerk upgraded us from a deluxe queen to deluxe king at no extra charge. Nice rooms + great service + great location = awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArienAbdisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like an oasis in the middle of busy city, San Francisco. We booked Urban Suit room, and the room is modern, large and quiet. The service was excellent, the reception was very helpful. and the most of all, this hotel is very good in location with reasonable price.. very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Quality but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: jc415
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for New Years Eve, the front desk staff was great when we checked in. Polite & friendly, we were offerend a complimentary drink when we arrived. We were checking into a room but when we arrived there housekeeping was just starting to clean it & basically just told us to go away. Went back downstairs & were appologized to & given a new room, however we were moved from the 5th floor to the 2nd floor, we were afraid this would be much noisier since it was NYE & there was a club just across the street. Overall the room was a good, a bit on the small side, but since we were going out it didn't seem like that big of a deal. It was very clean & well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. In the end we weren't really bothered by the noise & my husband liked the fact he could see the street and everyone going out on NYE from our window. What we were the most disappointed about was that when we wanted to check out the next morning & called down for our car (which we had valet parked - and were charged more for an "oversized" vehicle when it's really not that big) we were told that it would be 40 minutes or more to retreive our car. I realize that it was New Years Day, and everyone was checking out, but that seems odd to me. You know you're going to be busy so staff appropriately, don't be surprised when everyone "wants their car at the same time." You do afterall have a checkout time. What was the most disappointing about this was that the front desk person was not appologetic or helpful about it at all. Finally a manager came & we got our car, but I felt bad for leapfrogging all the people who were milling around the lobby waiting for their cars as well.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest and most helpful staff in SF. They make you feel like part of their family.”
Reviews.Author: judyfrank
Reviews.Content: Location is great -- within walking distance to restaurants, shopping. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We've been staying there for years and look forward to returning many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring San Fran - small, but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: NicTim10
Reviews.Content: All the staff, bar none, were so welcoming and helpful. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and presented and the location cannot be beaten. The rooms are rather small but have everything you need. We were given the choice of a room at the back, or one looking out onto the street. We chose one at the back (which I have a feeling are smaller), but the upside of that is it was whisper quiet, which is so hard to find in downtown SF. There's free internet access, and if you happen to be in the lobby at the right time, you can help yourself to a free cocktail. The Italian restaurant attached to the hotel is excellent (we ate there twice in less than a week) - I think that's the only food option actually, but you have plenty to choose from in the surrounding areas. You're right off Union Square (with lots of great shops), less than a minute from where the cable car that goes to Fishermans' Wharf turns round. The hotel's immediate area feels safe, but remember you are always going to come across people begging wherever you go in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic....going to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mkoskan
Reviews.Content: After much research, my colleagues and I decided to stay at this hotel. There was some disagreement b/c one of us wanted to stay and other nearby, bigger named hotels. However, our choice to stay at the Hotel Abri was the best decision. The hotel is perfectly located and the staff is wonderful and personable. The foyer had a very cool vibe, and it was nice walking in to the hotel. An added bonus, the elevator smells like cookies b/c they are nearby to an icecream store, and the smell is the baking icecream cones. The rooms were small, but I think that's standard for San Francisco. They certainly were big enough and not smaller than other hotel rooms that I saw. Everything was clean and comfortable. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with well trained, accommodating and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: malexf
Reviews.Content: Stayed in suite at the Hotel Abri. We held a small family meeting in the parlor two days. The room was very nice. well appointed, comfortable, though a bit small. Because of the meetings we had quite a few demands including special cleaning times. pots of coffee, extra parking etc. All were handled superbly by the staff. On one occasion the valet service took too long to deliver my car. At their own initiative I was not charged for parking that day. The restaurant that is adjacent to the hotel and provides breakfast and room service is only fair. Go elsewhere if you have the time. Also the hotel lacks a fitness center which I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: elmoody
Reviews.Content: This was only my second time in San Francisco, and so my experience is limited. I chose Hotel Abri becasue it was almost 100 dollars a night cheaper than my other options coming to the conference there. I expected to "get what I paid for" with a very small, run-down room. I was so pleasently surprised with a nice, spacious, clean, courteous hotel/room that it simply blew me away. I'm not sure why anyone would stay in the $250+ a night hotels...great job, Hotel Abri.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service = a satisfied guest”
Reviews.Author: JeffW41532
Reviews.Content: Two and 1/2 blocks to Union Square, two blocks to San Francisco Shopping Center and BART; two blocks to the Cable Car line = a good location for shopping and sightseeing. Smallish room--tastefully appointed with touches I've seen in high-end hotels--was cozy and comfortable. It's in the heart of downtown, so we expected to hear city sounds from the room, but we slept well and comfortably in a room overlooking the street. The crowning grace, though, was the excellent and helpful staff. We forgot to make dinner reservations and was out shopping, but a call to the concierge got us an 8pm table on Saturday night in a highly-rated restaurant. The front desk staff was uniformly friendly, interested in helping us enjoy our stay, and full of useful not-in-the-guidebooks information. We'd return to the hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fantastic guest services without a fault”
Reviews.Author: splow25
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel situated in the heart of Union Square, the shopping mecca (walking distance to Abercrombie & Fitch, American Eagles, Bloomingdale, Gap, Forever 21, H&M, Barney’s, Macy, Coach, )in SF! Within one block from the Bart Powell Station. From SFO, you just take the Bart up to Powell Station and walk one block to this hotel! It is also close to Walgreens, which is so convenient to get your bottled water, snacks, and fruits and other stuff! Starbucks Coffee and 7-11, Burger King, Subway, the banks and of course, the shopping haven are so so within a short walking distance! The hotel lobby décor is extremely appealing with fabulous friendly helpful staff. The room was clean with nice amenities. The bed is very comfy, and after all the sightseeing and shopping which is a must in SF. It’s hard to say much more about this hotel because it is so good.

Reviews.Title: “I checked out great reviews before I booked and this one was tops.”
Reviews.Author: charlello
Reviews.Content: This is a top European type hotel. It is a great price, perfect service, excellent location if you are in the city without a car. If you have no intentions of staying in your room all day, this is the place for you. The room and bathroom was small, very clean, great beds and really quiet. The front desk was very helpful and I would recommend this to anyone. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_philly
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri is a great choice for anyone looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Everyone on the staff was extremely nice, and helpful with restaurant recommendations, storing bags, calling cabs, etc. The rooms are small, but are perfectly fine if you are just using the room as a place to sleep. The hotel is in a very convenient location, just a block or two from several MUNI stops and a BART stop and a short walk to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Excellent stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RSRdG
Reviews.Content: What a great stay!!!! This hotel is extremely well located, near Union Square, Bart, Bus stops and major shopping areas. Room was very clean and with a modern decoration. Bathroom very spacious At our arrival, we were upgraded because it was our anniversary and there was even a bottle of wine compliments of the hotel waiting in our room. But service was SUPERB!!!. Front desk staff was more than Helpfull, specially ELLE, she was great, even helped us to get last minute tickets to see Placido Domingo at the Opera. Complimentary coffe at the room and the one offered at the lobby very good! This was my third visit to San Francisco this year, and this hotel was by far the most enjoyable. Now I found our Boutique hotel in SF, definitively coming back again.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abri is In the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: pbldoctor
Reviews.Content: Great location; hip and trendy interior; nicely appointed rooms. FREE internet access in your room! Really appreciate the fact that they recognize those serving in our military with special deals! We requested a room away from the elevators and stairs and our request was met 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent service! Staffs are all friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: waterdrop20
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed in Hotel Abri last week, absolutely love it! Great location, staffs are all very friendly and helpful. Thanks Jonathan at the front desk for the quick check in and upgraded our room to a 2 room suit for our long stay, he also called us 5 mins after we went into our room and make sure everything is ok... WOW! even a 5/6 stars hotel doesn't do that... he made us feel welcome to the hotel. Our room is clean and tidy everyday, the bed is very comfortable. Always love free internet access in room. Our room is facing the street, there are some noise at night, but I have no problem falling asleep, and with the hotel location, I wouldn't complaint for that little noise at all. The staffs also helped us to plan our tour and give good advices. My bf and I walked back to the hotel every nigt at around 9/10pm from the shopping area, although there were some homeless people around, but we still felt safe. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, and will definitely stay with Hotel Abri again next time we are in San Francisco. Thank you Hotel Abri, you made a difference to our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Occ-Doc16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had a one week stay at the Hotel Abri near Union Square, San Francisco. The service we experienced both before and during our stay was nothing short of fantastic and rivaled that of any five star hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect for attending a convention at the Moscone Center and ease in accessing public transporation. We were contacted by the the business office a few days prior to our arrival asking whether we had any concerns or questions about our stay. During our stay the doorman addressed all our transportation needs and addressed us personally by name. The front desk staff were incredibly accommodating and genuinely concerned about our well-being. The room was very clean, well furnished with a very comfortable bed. The one bed single room was slightly small but fine for two people. The restaurant next door, the Puccini and Panelli, served wonderful Italian food with reasonably priced happy hour appetizers. Other types of top notch international cuisine was located all within short walking distance. We loved our stay and this hotel and will return there to stay when we viist San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, and pretty noisy, but overall not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Geri258
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Abri in September, for one night and then later in the same week for two further nights. Positively the rooms are clean, and the staff were amazingly friendly with very good service. Also the hotel has a business area with two PC's and a printer that you can use for free- very handy for online check in for flights etc. Negatively the rooms are very small and on the first night we were awoken by noise from the street. Although we mentioned this to the staff and asked if we could have a quieter room when we returned in a few days and as a result got a free upgrade to a 5th floor executive room, which was larger and quieter. Also the hotel is located in Union Sq, SF's main shopping area. This is a central location but personally after having explored SF I would have rathered stayed in some other areas, such as Nob Hill. Union Sq is busy, noisy and a little bit dodgy- lots of homeless people and just a few blocks in the worng direction from the hotel you end up in the Tenderloin which is SF's worst area for crime- I ended up having to visit the police station there after being pickpocketed on my way from the airport to the hotel! And one small gripe- we payed for bed and breakfast. The breakfast is provided by a restaurant next door to the hotel, and the set offer is for an american breakfast. I don't eat eggs or pork (which is basically what an american breakfast is) and asked if I could change to granola (which is $3 cheaper on the restaurants menu) and they refused as this was outside of the set deal that they have with the hotel. As I said, a small gripe but it just annoyed me. So, overall, a decent hotel, which was good value, but I'm not sure I would rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely average”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler80
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is probably the best thing about this place. I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend and we were shocked at how small the room was. The room was big enough for a bed and tv. (that's it!) The best part of the room was the newly renovated bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful although the phone in our room did not work our entire stay. If you're looking for a somewhat descent sized hotel room, this is not the place to go. Although the location is great, there are about 50 other hotels within the same vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri is pretty average. Small rooms, but clean; relatively quiet, window air conditioner. Location is awesome: 1 blk from union square, 1 blk to the Uni and Bart Stations and the start of the Trolley line. You can get all over the place using the public transportation right there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: munchkins7
Reviews.Content: Husband I recently returned from a visit to the Abri. Would recommend this hotel to any and everyone. Hotel is a block from BART and around the corner from Powell Street. Our room was in the back so no street noise. The room was small. Big enough for a king size bed, desk, dresser and chair. Clean. The fit was a little tight, but since we were only in the room to sleep it was fine. I wish I could remember the name of the young man who checked us in. He was efficient, informative and very friendly. I had to pull my husband away once they started talking about the JETS. In fact, the entire staff was very friendly and welcoming and always asked if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable. We were in San Francisco during Fleet Week and on Thursday, walking back from the Golden Gate Bridge, we were buzzed by the Blue Angels. It was quite amazing and impressive to see them practicing over the Bay and city. Can't wait until my next visit to the City by the Bay and definitely will consider staying at the Abri again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in center of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jd_chilli_pepper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in late Sept while visiting friends. Having lived in bay area for number years and stayed in SF on business a number of times I was surprised at what a great job had been done of remodelling the old Monticello. Its a beautiful hotel and very close to all amenities - Cable Car, Union Square, China Town and Westfield Shopping Center. The rooms were beautifully decorated and I got interior room which was extremely quiet. There is no gym/swimming pool on site but they have an agreement with a local club to use their facilities for a small fee. The beautiful french toiletries in the shower room were a nice touch as was the in-room robe and free wifi... ! There is a commitment from staff to ensure your stay is a great one and its very noticeable. I have travelled all over the world on business and the attention here was some of the best of a much higher ranked hotels. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beau004
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but very comfortable. Beds excellent with lovely sheets and bedspread, pillows 1st class. Everything from a safe to lovely soaps supplied. Coffee in the room tasty. Very good location with great places to eat nearby..Tad's steakhouse just round the corner was brilliant....run by an exquisite little chinese lady. Thankyou David for the recommendation. All members of staff very helpful and very courteous They delivered a bottle of wine when they knew it was our wedding anniversity. Room and bathroom immaculate. We travelled extensively in America and enjoyed this place the most.......not the most luxurious we stayed in but the one we would definately go back to. They do not overcharge for anything and are quite prepared to find the best taxi rate for you when going somewhere........little touches like this make all the difference .Abri hotel, Union Square is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drtsparks
Reviews.Content: THis was a wonderful hotel in a perfect location! The staff were always helpful and always pleasant. Would stay here again and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: PearCat
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviewers - the service at the front desk is impeccable. The staff is helpful and personable. The hotel has a great atmosphere. We stayed on the second floor, facing toward an inner courtyard. Though the view's not great (ductwork), it was very quiet. We slept well in the very comfy beds. One comment, though. The previous reviewer alluded to the smell of fresh cookies. It's true, there is a pleasant scent in the lobby. Our room smelled good, too, but I think it might have been proximity to ventilation from the submarine sandwich shop two doors down! Just speculating. I would recommend the Abri, and hope to return one day with husband in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MChristineB
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and its location. Our room which I requested to be located away from the street was honored with no problems. Jonathan who checked us in was wonderful! In learning we were return visitors and celebrating our 18th wedding anniversary, he graciously upgraded us to a larger room. The room was comfy, cozy and the bed was sooo comfortable, Slept like a baby. EVERY ONE of the hotel staff displayed wonderful hospitality to us during our 4 day stay. My only wish, is a shower with more pressure. You could not ask for a better location or a great staff and rooms. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience & Location @Hotel Abri”
Reviews.Author: cassiesinnott
Reviews.Content: We took the BART from the airport to our hotel - it wasn't even a block away from the station! The location was great - it was so close to everything. The staff was always welcoming and helpful no matter what time of day. When we checked in the attendant was asking about our plans for SF and we explained that we didn't really have anything planned but sightseeing and visiting with friends - we were there for our 1st wedding anniversary. He upgraded our room to a suite and sent us a bottle of wine and made sure that our stay was an enjoyable one. Even the business center use was free! Overall one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: gowake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abri Sept 23 & 24 after being at the Fusion across the street earlier in the week for a conference. WORLD of difference! The Abri is clean and shiny. The rooms are small by most room standards but huge compared to the Fusion. We had a king bed, large desk, dresser, corner chair and nice size closet. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom large and spacious. Very large shower and everything was very clean. Just request an interior room to keep the majority of street noise down. The adjacent Italian restaurant is good. We ate 2 dinners there but did not try it for breakfast. The Abri could improve by offering a continental breakfast. They only offer tea and coffee. However, there are so many diners and restaurants within easy walking distance that it really doesn't matter. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and Jonathan at the front desk was extremely nice and willing to offer any assistance. The location of the Abri is in the Union Square area and close to the high end shopping, restaurants and just a block from the Westfield Centre (a five level shopping mall) and the cable car turnaround. The city tour buses pick up in front of Macy's - just 2 blocks away. We wish the entire week could have been spent at the Abri but now we know where to book when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TimandVal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of September 2010 for a few days in San Fran. The location is fair. Its close to shops, restaurants (although San Frans choice is not the best), the famous tram system just 100m away. Our room was a little cramped, but it was clean and business desk with network and usb charge points was handy. The staff were very helpful and friendly. All the main car rental offices within 5mins walk. Two minor compliants: Taxis dont stop regularly here, and you have to hail one some way from the hotel or the hotel have an arrangement with a 'chauffered car hire' company which had rates as good as most taxis. The second complaint is not aimed at the hotel, but this location is within a short walk to the Tenderloin area and the homeless problem is very pronounced in SF (more than any European city I have been in and far worse than LA) and several homeless stray around. The hotel was very evident in maintaining the safety and security of its lobby and customers. There are many hotels closer to the more susceptable areas but dont be surpirsed to come across these people on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September 2010 and would echo CityDoctor2007's review. The location is excellent - you are right in the heart of things for shopping, food and public transport (BART from the airport is a breeze and cheap at $8.10, FLine cars, buses and cable cars - all just one block away). The hotel itself left me feeling kind of 'meh'. It is perfectly nice and modern and we had no issues during our stay but it is maybe a little over-sold on their website. it is an older building that's been renovated but retains quite a few original features like interior doors and picture rails/skirting boards so the non-uniform room layouts and less convenient details (eg small wardrobe space in our room) are mainly due to that. The great TV, ipod dock, fridge, good coffee and decent hairdryer were all appreciated. The adjoining restauarant served great food but had slow service. Theres a fab Indian restaurant just a block away (looks a bit rundown outside, but great inside!) We'd probably stay at this hotel again due to the great location location but there are a few other hotels very nearby (eg Hilton) so it might be worth checking those out too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: REDFOOT7
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel located close to Union Square. Staff were excellent all round, they went out of their to help - luggage, sightseeing, dinner reservations and more! Would stay here when next in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good clientele”
Reviews.Author: Mangare_e_Bere
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri is located near Union Square on the border of the Tenderloin District. So tiy have the good and the bad- proximity to Union Square (and its bars - more on that in a second) and shopping, and a seedy element very nearby. I stayed there for two weeks in a row on two separate business trips. What I need is peace and qiuet at night - so I requested and got a top floor room in the interior of the hotel. The first week's stay was qiuet and uneventful and the staff is friendly. In San Francisco yo should not expect very large room sizes and you do not get one at the Hotel Abri. It is small, but comfortable enough. This week I stayed there again and things tun a bad turn. I am not saying that it is the hotel's fault, but after going to bed at 11 pm, I was awakened at 2:15 in the morning by loud talk and even shouting in the hallway outside my room. I was literally startled awake. I opened the door and asked the 2 men outside to please be quiet, I was rudely cussed at by one of them. I siad I was going to call security and he dared me to and threatened me. I closed the door and called the front desk. Here is where the hotel has to accept responsibility. The front deak person could have cared less. I asked for them to send up security and he said they didn;t have any and that he would call the police. I said yes please do so as the two men had entered the room next to me and were carrying on and partying very loudly, with knocks at their door from other men and a lot of shouting and drunken, foul language coming through the walls and door. Meanwhile, nothing from the hotel, no police, nothing. I was kept awake until 4 in the morning. Shame on the drunken louts who have no respect for anyone inclusing themselves, and shame on Hotel Abri for not protecting their guests from people like this. Th eleast the hotel could have done was move me to a new room. I wil never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, but maybe some street noise”
Reviews.Author: graceinbeijing
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel at the end of our trip to SF and Yosemite. This was excellent value. The interior is very nicely decorated, we had a suite room with the bathroom between the BDRM and LR, which was perfect for a family with two elementary age kids. There were nice toiletries, coffee in the morning, and very personal service. I would definitely look for Larkspur again. Unfortunately we had a second floor room and there was some street noise, which maybe we should have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair room”
Reviews.Author: CityDoctor2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway for a wedding anniversary. Excellent location- a block from the BART and the Powell Street Cable car turnaround. The room was small and somewhat cramped. This is an older hotel and they have clearly done some upgrading but could use some more work. The bed was amazingly comfortable. There was no tub in the bathroom--which was surprising. The guy at the desk offered us one of two rooms, a quiet room with no view or one looking over the street that would be a bit noisier. We chose the one looking over the street, the noise wasn't bad but there certainly was not a view (the window was tiny). Service staff were friendly and helpful. Would consider staying here again, but think you might be able to do better at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy hotel. They cheaped out on the renovations.”
Reviews.Author: eleanor714
Reviews.Content: Firts of all, I do have to say that the staff at the hotel was more than helpful and tried to be accomodating. The bellman and Jonathan was very nice. That being said, I took the advice of the other contributors from TripAdvisor and decided we would try out the Hotel Abri for our stay in San Francisco. The lobby was beautiful. The had gutted it and completely redone the lobby. It was sleeky, modern and gorgeous. They had decided not to continue this motif beyond that. We stepped off the elevator and I physically hesitated. It was a long creepy dim hallway to our room. The first room we were in was a decent size but it was only because it was the ADA handicap room. There was a very loud humming/buzzing sound eminating from the room. A fire truck went by and we had to stop our conversation otherwise we couldn't hear what the other was saying. And what we were saying was that the room was dark and creepy. Instead of gutting the room and redoing it, like the lobby, they just threw a thick coat of paint over everything. The door, which was probably older than I am, creaked when it opened in a 1920's farmhouse way. There was no light in the closet. In fact there was only one dim light on the ceiling and the lamp at the desk. The wires from the switch ran along the wall up to the light. They just painted over the wires instead of running it inside the wall. It looked dangerous! Jonathan called to make sure everything was ok and we said it wasn't. He said he was happy to move us. So we went to the room down the hall. It was about a 3rd of the size with all the same "creepy" amenities. Jonathan called again and I told him I didn't think this was a King room. He said we were right but there weren't any other rooms available but was happy to reduce our rate by $20 a night. Are you freakin kidding me? For a room a third of the size and a smaller bed? BTW - Did I mention it was $53 a day to park our car?!? My husband and I decided we were going to leave. We were just not comfortable in the room, especially what we paid for it! We told Jonathan of our decision and while we called around to try and find another place. They did agree to not charge us for the one night room for changing our minds. I was very dissapointed with this hotel. I know that the Larkspur hotels are usually very nice and luxurious but they just cheaped out on this one. Instead of completely gutting it and redoing it, like the lobby, they just threw a coat of paitn over everything and put some high end lotions in the bathroom. This does not make for a luxury hotel. Will not make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: marinchik86
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri offers nice, big and clean rooms with small accessories like coffee machine, tea, free wi fi, and other things for convenience. Stuff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again. Aside from being right in the center of the city, the prices are much less than other hotels around and offers great services.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Service”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to the Warfield Theater where I was doing business with an artist. The hotel was easy to get to from SFO airport using Lorrie's shuttle service. Lorrie's shuttle stand is right outside the arrival terminal and we were picked us within minutes of arriving at the stand. Johnathan checked us into the hotel. Johnathan could not have been more friendly or helpful. Jonathan made sure we had a quiet room and gave us a map to show us how to get to the Warfield Theater. Johnathan also showed us how to get to another club we were going to along with recommending restaurants in that area. A few minutes after we were in our room Johnathan called us to make sure the room was actually what we wanted, which it was because the room was spacious with all the modern amenities. The bed was very comfortable. There was nice working area for your computer and it was nice to be able to play our IPod. The hotel is in great area of the city with many shops and restaurants. It is easy to get around either using the tram or BART or taxi. Since the weather was perfect we did a lot of walking around the city. The restaurant, Puccini, attached to the hotel is great for happy hour and food. Their happy hour is 7 days a week!! We had such a great experience at this hotel we are now going to make it our regular hotel in San Francisco. Stay here you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “You SHOULD choose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SanFrancisco060
Reviews.Content: From the door service man to the front desk personnel to the maid service, ALL is excellent customer service at this Hotel Abri in San Francisco. All the employees are very kind and friendly, and are willing to do everything to make you happy. I spoke with the manager as well, and he was very kind and willing to talk to us to make sure we had an excellent stay. If I ever get back to San Francisco, I will stay at the Hotel Abri again. It's in a great location; 1 block from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with friendly staff in central location - fully recommended”
Reviews.Author: bloemkool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, only 2 minute walk from the bottom of Powell street where the cable car is. The rooms are well equiped and every clean. The staff are very helpful and are happy to help with any queries about the city, getting around etc. The first night we stayed in a nice room at the front of the hotel (street side) but it was very noisy due to a night club just opposite the hotel. Having just travelled from UK, we were so tired and a bit upset about this noise. However the night warden was extremely understanding and he made sure we were moved to a room at the back of the hotel, which was absolutely lovely and the next 2 nights we slept like a log. I must say this hotel was one of our favourite hotels during our holiday. I would say this was due to its location, the room itself and the lovely staff! When booking your room and checking into hotel, just make sure they can give you a room at the back of hotel if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: triniluv09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Abri for 3 nights and we loved it. The staff went out of their way to help us with whatever we needed. Our room was extremely clean and comfortable. We had nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dforsyth
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Hiton, Intercon, Sheraton etc but the Abri was a special rate on Expedia so I took a chance and it was well worth it. Great location just off Market Street, O'Farrell and Union Square. Superb staff, very clean and comfortable but small rooms. Had 2 interior rooms - very quite and slept very well. Attached restaurant/bar is great - happy hour 3-6pm (3-10pm) Sun thru Tuesday nights with beers and wine at $3 and light bar snacks; restaurant also good if a little expensive but again great staff, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 49mlm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, Your staff is among the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered. And my Granddaughter thought the orange gumballs were the best part of the stay. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed Ever!”
Reviews.Author: CherylM015
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in San Fran for 5 nights in July and found a great hotel/flight package through Expedia. The hotel was wonderful overall - amazing location and very cute lobby. It was modern but very welcoming at the same time. Happy hour shots at the front desk from 5-7 which was a nice perk. The restaurant connected to the hotel is horrible - do not eat there. Extremely overpriced and horrible. San Fransisco has some of the most amazing food...most of which is a few blocks away from Hotel Abri. Great staff, fantastic bed, huge TV but be warned - they are itty rooms. The suites are three times as large but the regular rooms are quite crammed. The bed and the shower make up for it though. No counter space by the sink in the bathroom which I found odd but was able to accommodate. Overall great stay and positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely smaller hotel in the perfect location for activities”
Reviews.Author: bentleyandzoesmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first San Francisco visit, and I must say the Hotel Abri is wonderful. I did alot of research and planning before choosing this hotel, and it was not a disappointment at all. The location is probably the best in town, as far as close to buses, BART system and cable cars. It's also around the corner from the Visitor's Center. The staff was always friendly and accomodating. The rooms are on the smaller end of things, but that was fine since we didn't spend alot of time in ours. We were out sightseeing, but coming back to the bed at the Abri was incredible. Definitely the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I'm now bugging my husband to get us a new mattress!!!! Like other reviews, if you don't want noise at night, due to the night club across the street, simply call a few days ahead and ask for an interior room. That's exactly what I did and we were given exactly that!!!! Can't say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ligaya1923
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to SF and this hotel really sealed it! I always book and plan our trips and usually i book hotels from those big chains or resort like places but to my surprise Hotel Abri now changed me.It was smaller rooms compared to the ones im used to but the cleanliness of the room most esp the bathroom is impeccable. The bed is so comfortable, it felt like home.The only thing i didnt like about the room is the long writing table that took a big space inside the room but the empty fridge was perfect to put our stuff, the big tv was good and the ac was adequate.The service was perfect! I was so impressed with the check in.We got there early and they didnt give us any problem with early check in ( i think it was Jonathan) and he even gave us tips on how to easily go around SF.I also like the fact that when i call the desk it only takes 1 to 2 rings and someone very pleasant answers. The hair dryer was not working and they replaced it right away with out any hesitation.The location is very good too, close to all good food, shopping and other interests! I cant wait to go back and now i start looking at boutique hotels before booking in big chain hotels because of my wonderful experience here in Hotel Abri! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Visit!”
Reviews.Author: brynababy
Reviews.Content: We just had an ideal stay- at a Larkspur Hotel- The Abri in San Francisco. Everything about the hotel was perfect. It's small and intimate, first of all. The decor is so handsome and pleasant to be in. The paint colors were rich but relaxing, the room was gorgeous. I loved the shiny lite fabric on the windows, so unusual and so stunning. The bed was a dream as were the pillows (not the usual stiff foam rubber, and the linens were delicious to the touch. Even the lamps and the fixtures in the bathroom were such a handsome design, you couldn't help admiring the artistic sensibility shown. The shower was fabulous- hot, full spray, easy to handle. I can't imagine what another reviewer was referring to when he said "don't expect the internet to work". The ease with which we could use the two free computers in the lobby really meant a lot to us on this particular trip. Then of course, the important thing- SERVICE! The staff without exception were so attentive and helpful and so charming in their attitude and demeanor, we just couldn't get over it. Only minus is the $43 overnight parking, which apparently all the hotels in that area charge. Plus, lots of public parking nearby at less than half the price. And you can stay in front while you check in and get settled in your room.

Reviews.Title: “great staff. small but nice rooms. don't expect the internet to work”
Reviews.Author: mrkellar
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely seven day stay at the Hotel Abri. When we arrived we asked for an upgraded room but none were available for two days. We hunkered down in a very small interior room; if we’d been visiting for a few days it would have been sufficient but as we were there for a week there wasn’t even room to open our suitcases. There’s no view from these interior rooms but at least it’s quiet and a good sleep was the priority. They hotel moved us to a new room two days later; strangely it was the exact same room in a different part of the building. There seemed to have been some mix-up regarding why we wanted a new room but they quickly resolved that and relocated us again. From 414 to 404 and finally to room 203 where we stayed for the final 5 days of our trip. 203 is a wheelchair accessible room with plenty of space and afforded us room to open our suitcases and keep them open. The staff was fantastic and I’d recommend the hotel for that alone. It’s a small hotel so when you came in after a day of adventure or when you left in the morning you were greeted by familiar faces. I appreciate that when renovating the hotel they maintained much of the original infrastructure. The moldings around the doors for example are caked with a century of paint which I think adds to the charm and history of the property. The only major issue was the internet. On their website they say it’s complimentary and it was one of the reasons we booked with them; internet should be free in a hotel just as TVs are. Unfortunately after three days of phoning tech support, the front desk, and talking with various staff, the problem was not resolved. Neither my iPhone or iPad would connect to WIFI and having come from Canada I didn’t have 3G service. Thankfully there’s free WIFI that works perfectly a few doors down at the Starbucks. If you’re a business traveler who requires internet often and wants to have it in the comfort of your room rather that in the very public business center (also complimentary) I’d recommend against staying here. I realize that the Abri doesn’t have tech staff and that this area of customer service is contracted out but the people who they’ve contracted need training and need to update their infrastructure. They finally told me that the iPad and iPhone aren’t supported. This seems crazy; both of these devices strictly adhere to wireless standards and moreover, work with every other WIFI hotspot I’ve ever tried. Long story short, the complimentary internet didn’t work as advertised. To be fair, had I brought a computer there is a physical Ethernet port in the room as well which we may have had more success with. There are so many great places to stay in San Francisco that I would likely try somewhere else on a return visit. The inability to resolve our internet issues in the seven days we were there was a real let down. Internet aside, the staff are lovely, the rooms are clean and well appointed (though tiny), and the place simply has a nice vibe. If the price is right I say book away because more than anything you can’t beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimJ
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in a suite with my wife and 2 children (12, 11) in early July. Overall we had a great stay. We had an inside room on the 5th floor so night time noise that others have reported was not a problem. The room was clean and spacious (for San Francisco - ie it was pretty small but perfectly adequate for our needs) and the location can't be beaten. About 3 minutes walk to Union Square and the Powell street BART where the cable cars turn around so a great base for sightseeing. The front desk staff and bell boys were always friendly and extremely helpful with their recommendations and there was free tea and coffee in the lobby each morning. The attached bar was also a great place for an early evening drink as they seem to have a happy hour with discounted drinks and bar food most nights. Extremely minor negative points - there was no bath in the bathroom only a shower and the door was made of glass so switching the light on at night flooded the whole suite in light waking up anyone who was sleeping. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for anybody wanting a central base to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: yuckers
Reviews.Content: this was a nice hotel. very clean and comfortable. our room was located on the street so it was a bit noisy because there was a club right across the street so you could hear the chatter among those waiting to get in. the hotel employee asked if we would mind the noise and we said we didn't but it was noisier than we expected. we thought it would be worth having a view of the street but the window is so small that it does not offer a view really.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrwms
Reviews.Content: Great hotel Great Location I took my wife to San Francisco to celebrate her birthday in Chinatown with her best friend who moved there a few years ago, to celebrate the 4th of July at Pier 39 and to have fun in the city. Pros • Cool accommodating staff • Located at the first stop of the SF Cable Car line • Near all transportation • Walking distance to many attractions • Restaurant w/daily Happy Hours • G eat shopping area for discount and high end fashions • Individual personal size bags of ice in freezer (my personal favorite detail) No dirty ice machine. • Daily free afternoon fruit drinks (sometimes w/alcohol) • FREE Wi-Fi and free use to their computers w/printers • Great rates! Cons • Street side rooms can be noisy at night until the club across the street closes at 2am. (“Fusion” is nice club w/a nice happy hour ( if you like those sort of things}. We had one of those rooms and requested a change to an inside room the next day. We got an immediate room change with a smile. I read about the front rooms in a TripAdvisor review, so I knew what to expect. If we did not get a room change at least the noise would not have been a surprise. And it was not so very bad that we could not have tolerated it if necessary. Tips We rented a car for two days and went to all the places that were too far to walk to. We drove to several wineries in Nappa Valley, the Golden Gate Bridge, Pier 39, Sausalito, down Lombard Street, world’s most crooked street and many other places with the GPS we brought along. The best part of our trip was visiting Sam’s Chowder Mobile near the Japanese Tea Garden in Golden Gate State Park. Their famous clam chowder and lobster rolls were so good that we drove to their restaurant (Sam’s Chowder House ( 4210 Cabrillo Highway North, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019-5221, for lunch two days later. It was worth the long scenic drive. Scoma's Restaurant at Fisherman's Wharf was superb!! Probably the best on the Wharf. We rented a Toyota Corolla for 2 days for about $80.00 total from Reliable Rental Car Company just a few blocks away at 349 Mason St. If we had read the reviews on this company we probably would not have rented from them, but we did a walk-in, got a decent car and had no problems. They were very nice and accommodating. The great thing about that company was that they allow you to park in their garage just two short blocks from Hotel Abri. Parking in that area is generally $35-$45 per night, so free parking was really good. With the price of parking in the area it’s like we got the car for free. Check weather and temperatures and dress for cooler climate.

Reviews.Title: “We had the most amazing time staying here!”
Reviews.Author: ds_wk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri was great. It is situated just of Union Square so perfect for shopping, restaurants and sightseeing. We stayed for two weeks and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. When we arrived we even got an upgrade to a hotel suite! The room was large and off the street so very quiet. We loved the shower and the bed was very comfortable! If we would go to San Francisco again we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: sheryl0202
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The lobby is filled with lemongrass scents, classy yet modern. The room is not that big but all the amenities were there! The bed and pillows are so comfortable. Excellent service from all the front staffs especially Jonathan.This is my favourite hotel out of the 5 that I stayed in San Francisco. Too bad I only stayed for one night, I will definitely stay there again if I go to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nicely appointed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LA_Andrew
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay at the Abri again. Great location near the end of the Cable Car route, close to shopping and the BART station. Rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were very nice. A proper roomy stand-up shower rather than standing in a tub! Friendly staff, from the front desk to the maintenance personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice! Wonderful hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: annaclaudia1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights at the end of May. The hotel is very nice. The atmosphere is cozy, like you're in your own home. The room is wonderful, incredibly spacious, well furnished and finely decorated, the bed is very comfortable, the bathroom is great as well as the bathroom's amenities. All the employees are extremely polite and always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Bullseye”
Reviews.Author: Lumamendes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri is one of the best hotels I've ever been. Clean, well designed and a walking distance from all you need: restaurants, shops, SFMOMA, Yerba Buena, movie theaters, Apple Store and, of course, F Line, Muni and BART station. You can easily go from the airport to the hotel by a fast train in just 30 minutes on a US$8 fee. The hotel crew is great. Genuine kind and gentle. Room is quite small. A big chubby couple could feel a little uncomfortable. If that's not your case, you can enjoy a refreshing bed and plug your computer on the 42 plasma TV to watch your movies. Just don't forget to bring a VGA+Audio or HDMI cable. Internet connecting is free but slow. Just enough to read your e-mails and that is good for you - hit the road and go buy a book at City Lights! By the way, morning coffee and late afternoon free drinks are a must. Seek no more. This is a risk-free choice to enjoy San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great service. excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mayurindia
Reviews.Content: stayed here last year for 4 nights. very helpful staff - it was my first visit to san francisco, although my wife had traveled earlier for work - the staff was constantly recommending places to see - restaurants we must eat at - where to shop - we rented a mustang and they helped us finding parking - and made our stay worth it. Rooms were newly renovated - like the iPod dock on the bed side :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: threeonrtheroad
Reviews.Content: Husband, daughter and I stayed for four nights in mid-June. The location -- which is right around the corner from the Powell Street cable car, trolley and muni stop -- couldn't be better. The staff were friendly and very helpful -- and even sent up a bottle of wine when they learned we were celebrating our anniversary. The "featherbourne" bed was unbelievably comfortable -- better than any hotel bed I've experienced. The building is older and so the room spaces are not very large and a bit awkwardly shaped. But the fabulous bed and the bathroom --which was clean and modern and well-equipped -- more than made up for the space. A couple of caveats: As others have noted here, you will want to request an inside room facing the courtyard so you don't have to listen to the street noise coming from the traffic or the club across the street. Also, don't eat at the P&P hotel adjacent to the hotel. It's mediocre (at best) and there are many great choices just a short walk -- or cable car ride -- from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: pomonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and chose this hotel largely on the basis of reviews at Tripadvisor. Certainly a great location with all you need nearby.We had a package which included transfers to and from SFO, which worked very well. We had a room overlooking the inner "court". As a result we suffered no disturbance from traffic etc noise. The room was pretty small but as a place to "lay your head" worked OK. Beds were very comfortable and the decor was smart and clean. A problem with the safe was sorted by house keeping in minutes. However, as an older building refurb'd, it did have some problems. For example, although we heard no noise from adjoining rooms, we heard literally every movement from the room overhead. Staff were pretty obliging and efficient. Overall we didn't really feel this was anything but a pretty good city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: Pitztop
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia only because it was part of a package deal and becasue it was located near BART station in the Union Square area. It turned out to be a gem! From the moment the front doors were opened for us, we were given the VIP treatment! Tyler greeted us with a happy smile, allowed us to check in a 11 am, and sent up a bottle of wine when he found out we were celebrating our anniversary. The staff really hustled to satisfy our every request and acted like they enjoyed working there. There was definitely a determination to provide the best customer satisfaction. The hotel was recently renovated and shows both the old fashioned charm and the new updated look. The lobby looks like a nice Starbucks and the bathrooms have new fixtures. The flat screen is big too and the walls are freshly painted. The King Size room was on the small side...but not any smaller than what you would find in New York for the same price range. The hotel is located within a block of the Powel St cable car turnaround, the BART, and the F Line Street Car. So the only reason to rent a cab was when we were in a hurry to get to a dinner reservation. The Italian restaurant next door is wonderful and open late. If you retire early and want peace and quiet, then you need to get a room facing the inner courtyard. No view...but very quiet. I wanted a view, so I took a room on the 5th floor facing Ellis and overlooking the Fusion Lounge across the street. That club is very popular and noisy up until 2 am. But I didn't mind since I was up past midnight anyway. But I can imagine other people would not like it. If I could get the same deal, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonersThailand
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel experience we've ever had. The room was tiny, dark, as badly organized as possible & the window looked out on a wall. Outside the the window there were empty coke cans & the remains of a dead bird. When we told reception they didn't seem to care in the least. No insulation whatsoever - you hear the footsteps above you, the people in the hall & everything going on in the next room. No cellphone reception in the room so good luck communicating with the outside world. When we asked for another room we were told they could move us but only to a street facing room, which is just opposite a nightclub & it would be very loud. The windows don't have double glazing & when we went to see the room we saw that the window also doesn't close all the way - no wonder it's so loud. Horrendous experience, we ran away as quickly as humanly possible after one night & relocated to the wonderful Monaco hotel. Go anywhere but here - it really doesn't get much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Really great staff”
Reviews.Author: webgoddesscathy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Abri when I was attending a conference at the Moscone Centre. The proximity was perfect - a very short walk over. The room was OK - I chose a small room and it was small, but comfortable. I honestly didn't spend much time in it, but it was nice. I would say it was excellent value for the money! (And I'm very cheap.) The internet access for me and my colleague was spotty, but their tech support couldn't figure out why. I'm not sure if it might have had something to do with our computer set up or not. The computers downstairs in the lobby, however, were a great back-up. We spoke to the staff several times for recommendations on places to eat or how to get somewhere and they were so nice and helpful! My colleague did make a change to stay in a quieter room and that was important for him and they were very nice about it - giving him a larger room for the same price, due to availability.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel but wise to get a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Claypole
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed wth the Hotel Abri which started our West coast and Nevada trip. We stayed 4 nights. Big room with King Bed, nice bathroom and very polite and friendly staff. They offer complimentary coffee and tea in reception in the mornings which was nice. I had requested a street view but with hindsight should have gone for a "quiet room" which overlook a courtyard. The street is very noisy. As the hotel is round the corner from the cable car turnaround (great location) you hear the trams constantly and they run til 1.30am starting 5.30am (from memory). There is also a bar opposite. With the traffic saturday nights are particularly loud. If you are a heavy sleeper no probs! The hotel is great and one block from the cable turnaround, 10 min walk to Union Square and a big mall is just around the corner. Would happily recommend and go back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Don1947
Reviews.Content: I learned about Hotel Abri through a colleague who was traveling to the same business meeting as I was. Neither of us had visited Hotel Abri before but the location was across the street from the hotel where our business meeting was being held at a much lower rate so we decided to check it out. Both of us were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable and the hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Hotel Abri is located a short block and easy walk from the Powell Street station of BART so if you're visiting San Francisco by air, you can save a bundle on transportation to the hotel vs. taxi or shuttle from either SFO or OAK. If you do decide to book this hotel and you're a light sleeper and not an nightowl, ask for an inside room, if available. If you have an outside room (as I did) the street noise can get very loud although it settles down after midnight. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who prefers to stay in the Union Square area of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rickurt
Reviews.Content: This is a great hip and trendy boutique hotel. Very modern in an outstanding location close to Union Square and Market avenue. The trolley, bus stop and metro station are just around the corner. The hotel is right in front of one of the trendiest clubs in SF. We got a free upgrade to a suite and it was great. The employees in this hotel can write a book about customer service. They are phenomenal!!! They took care of every small detail. They even help with my cat and my daughter. Always smiling and greeting you. Seriously, I cannot say ennough about the hotel staff...they are just superb!!!! This hotel is perfect for everyone, from singles to old couples. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaCop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Abri two consecutive weekends and it was excellent. I got an urban suite with King size bed both times and the rooms were both great. The beds were very comfortable. I has asked for a quiet room and they put me in a room overlooking the inner courtyard. This was extremely quiet and I would recommend asking for these rooms if you want to avoid the noise mentioned in other reviews. The hotel is within a block of MUNI and BART so is very convenient. There is an attached bar / restaurant but there are also plenty of other choices nearby. The staff was very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “great room setup for family with two teens”
Reviews.Author: mctomi
Reviews.Content: we have two teenagers. the king suite has a bedroom and a sitting room with a very large pull out bed. it worked out great for us and is more economical then getting two rooms and way more comfortable than getting one room with two double beds! the hotel is in the middle of everything and windows look out into the street so noise maybe a problem. but you gotta expect that! we have stayed at other san francisco hotels with family suites but the kids rooms tend to be geared toward very little kids (bunk beds, dress up toys, tiny chairs) so this was a real find for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, high quality experience”
Reviews.Author: GamerGirl-STL
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely delightful stay. The hotel's location is excellent, just around the corner from the cablecar, a block away from Union Square, convenient walking distance from the Moscone Center, and restaurants literally right next door, from ice cream to a Subway to classier dining a block away. Despite the busy city noises outside, I asked for a quiet room, and had zero problem with noise. The room was small, but clean, comfortable, with very classy modern decor. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, the business center easily available, and every detail was handled to perfection, down to the delightful soap in each room. Provided that I could handle the price range, I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, Great stay”
Reviews.Author: danie_deleon
Reviews.Content: My family and I only stayed 2 nights at this hotel but the 2 nights we did stay were great. It was right next to the BART station which was great because there was no need to rent a car. The front desk people knew the area well and was able to give great advice on places to eat and great direction on how to use the public transportation. We were not in our room much, just to sleep, but the time spent in our room was nice. There was some street noise but that is to be expected since you are downtown (we are city people so this was not an issue). The only thing which has nothing to do with our stay is the room service gets its food from a place next door to the hotel which is not owned by the hotel and is a bit pricey but the food taste great so it was worth it and the hotel does not service breakfast so you have to walk to some place near by.... So if you are just planning on staying here for a place to sleep or for business I would recommend this place but if you are planning own spending time in your room I would say stay in someplace like the Marriott. San Franciso is a bit pricey to eat out for 3 meals with kids....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: jimok78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Abri for a couple of nights whilst on holiday in San Francisco with friends. As others have mentioned, the hotel staff on the front desk and pretty helpful and give you a warm welcome. Rooms are very comfortable (I had a two room suite), however the bedroom is a little small. Can not fault the hotel for cleanliness. The hotel has a nice feel to it, and the bar next door (not strictly part of the hotel, but there is a door in the hotel that goes straight to it) is very good. They have a very well priced happy hour menu, and some great food. I would certainly stay in the Abri again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great location, Room poorly sound proof from street noise”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Traveler_Advice
Reviews.Content: - Rooms are clean, very comfortable. They are small but efficient organized. - Hotel Staff very friendly, helpful. - Hotel location is excellent( to shopping, two blocks away from Union Square), Lots of activity and One block away from Powell's Cable Car & main public transportation stop (for Muni & BART). - Main disadvantage: Surprisingly the guest rooms are poorly insulated from street noise for this star level of hotel, My party was awoken from noise every night stayed there, always before the sun came up: mainly from street noise, nightclub across street, trash collection, street cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Prefect location, great service, but be aware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: meandstar
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me about the hotel was how helpful and friendly the staff are. Location is prefect for Union Square ,cable car ,shopping and getting to other points of interest. Rooms are a little smaller than I expected from photos (we had King room) which makes a little squashed with the amount of luggage we had but they are nicely appointed .
