One issue for me was the valet parking charges which were not explained and displayed clearly. There are no hotel free parking options and I did not know the area having just arrived . The sign said valet parking was $43 and when I asked if this was a flat cost no matter how many times I got the car out I was told yes it was a flat charge. What was not explained or indicated on the sign was that it was $43 per night of stay so I was shocked with the bill. ( we stayed 3 nights) They need to show clearly on the sign that it is $43 per night of stay and have the reception staff explain this to you .( I am new to the USA and valet parking systems. The hotel staff did offer to ask the manager to waiver the 2nd 2 nights for me due to the misunderstanding but I am still waiting to hear from them by email .

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco... Honest”
Reviews.Author: demantus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small enough to be personal and big enough to feel you are in the "big city". It is close to everything and still quiet and peaceful at night. the staff was always happy and helpful, we felt taken care of by everyone. The room was clean and very comfortable. We will stay at the Hotel Abri on our next trip to the city , FOR SURE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: rbwii
Reviews.Content: Much, much more than we expected. This remodeled boutique hotel is very cool and the location is fantastic. The Queen Room is a little small (bathroom, too) and the desk was in an awkward location but it really didn't matter much. I would absolutely recommend the Abri - especially if you get a good rate. The L'Occitane toiletry products are fantastic, too. They do well with the little touches. NOTE: the Italian restaurant below is surprisingly delicious. Try the Tuscan Lasnania (the best I've EVER had - even while in Italy) and and Absolute Acai Berry (new flavor) with simple syrup, soda, and lime juice. It will change your life.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-size boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: njw811
Reviews.Content: Located smack-bang in the middle of downtown, easy access to Market, cable cars, street cars, restaurants, shopping, union square... friendly staff, clean and well maintained. pre-1906 earthquake building with character and all the mod-cons too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price”
Reviews.Author: moonsong70
Reviews.Content: I wanted a centrally located hotel with good reviews on Trip Advisor for a reasonable price. I found a 48 hour sale on Travelocity and got a queen-size room for $88 a night. I arrived on Sunday afternoon and the young man behind the desk said that the queen size was not ready but he would upgrade me to a king-size. (Rm 503) Tyler then helped me carry my luggage up to the room and saw that I was happy with the upgrade. All of the staff were just as friendly and helpful as Tyler. The location was just off Market Street, near Union Square, and just one block from the cable car street that took you to Ghirardelli Square. I was blessed by a week with no rain so I was able to walk everywhere. I met my daughter and grandchildren who stayed at an expensive hotel about 6 blocks away. We were able to meet each morning at a coffee shop for breakfast and head out for a day of sightseeing. The Hotel Abri is an older hotel, but the renovations were well done, and the bed was very comfortable. The Italian restaurant connected to the hotel was excellent, though a little noisy. I was very comfortable going into the bar by myself. I would go back there if I make another trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy due to nightclub”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyawayLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, but our room on the top floor street side, was sooooo noisy late at night due to the infusion lounge across the street. the club closes at 2am and between the screaming and the police, no chance of getting a good nights sleep. We tried to move to an inside room but no luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...terrific location, friendly service, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: CARileysmom5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Saturday night - they even upgraded us to a suite. We enjoyed drinks at Puccini & Pinetti (next door), then took in a play. Loved that it was so convenient to BART. We've already recommended it to several people. Have to say that it does get noisy outside when Infusion Lounge lets out, but that's not the fault of the hotel. Noise diminished after we closed the room darkening drapes. Will definitely stay here again next time we come into the city. The bed was super comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best night's sleep I've ever had in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bradbear59
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of the Hotel Abri in San Francisco until a friend directed me to their website. I figured they were just another decent hotel in SF, but I was wrong. From the beginning, the staff was very friendly and helpful and answered all questions quickly and directly. I loved the bed in my room and the pillows were the most comfortable I had ever slept on. I would definitely suggest this hotel to friends and family visiting San francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Room, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TSPrufrock
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. The suite rooms were large and as advertised. We were originally placed in a corner room on a lower floor which was a bit too noisy for our tastes, and we asked to move. The staff didn't hesitate, and quickly moved us to a 5th floor suite on the back of the hotel that was so quiet you could hear bugs chirping outside. The staff was friendly, made small talk and generally seemed to enjoy their jobs. The location is central to everything fun to do in Union Square, w/easy access through public transport to other parts of the city. The beds were clean and comfortable, and the size was just right for a long weekend. Highly recommend and I'm a very picky traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ABRI!”
Reviews.Author: RondaFulster
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Abri.The staff is friendly, polite, helpful, warm and inviting. The rooms although small are very clean, decorated well, comfortable and relaxing. The room windows open, which makes for a nice San francisco breeze and fun City noise! The hotel offers coffee in the room, but you will find a great cup waiting for you in the lobby. The location was just a short walk to the Mascone Center and Market Street. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Hipster hotel a block away from Powell Station”
Reviews.Author: Airstreamlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here earlier this week with my husband for a tradeshow at Moscone, and paid a very good rate (through the tradeshow) of $79.00/night. I was really impressed with this hotel. It has a youngish, hipster feel to it, but there is no attitude. All the staff encountered were cheerful and friendly, always greeting us in our comings and goings. Our room had a queen bed and the floorplan was really small (couldn't even stretch out to do pilates!), but we've come to expect that in downtown SF hotels. The staff member who checked us in asked if we would like an inner room (quiet) or a street view room (noisier). We opted for a quiet inner room, and can vouch that it was very quiet, with black-out drapes that make it pitch dark. Had excellent sleep all three nights. Room was clean, and the l'Occitane bath products were a treat. There are two internet stations in lobby. The location is so convenient, only a block away from Westfield shopping centre and the BART Powell station. Lots of dining options, particularly recommend "Herbert's Mexican" (in lobby of Herbert Hotel) and "The Burger Bar" on the 6th floor of Macy's. All are within three blocks to the hotel. Would love to stay at this hotel again if we can get a good price. Thanks to all the friendly staff for a super stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DogsNcatspettsitter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the newly renovated Hotel Abri in Union Square and had a wonderful experience. Next time I'm in San Francisco I'll definitely stay there again. I was there a few years ago when it was the Monticello Inn and the transformation is incredible. My suite was beautiful, elegant, spacious and spotless. The decor was modern yet comfy with large flat screen TV's in the living room & bedroom. The bed was wonderful and the bathroom was huge. The staff was friendly and attentive. They called me minutes after I checked in to see if I liked the room. They have a complimentary wine hour which they extended for the whole day I checked in. The free chocolate bar was yummy! Great location a couple of blocks to Union Square, Cable Cars and fabulous restaurants & shopping. I highly recommend the Hotel Abri to anyone going to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abri - a real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: markd71
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again - staff friendliness was outstanding and location was perfect for my needs. The staff made me feel welcome and being a first time international visitor to S/F this was greatly appreciated. I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, You get wut u pay for”
Reviews.Author: ucLAkers562
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in da heart of Union Square. Newly renovated, but the living room space was small, bathrooms aren't super private, Bedroom was great doe. Sofa bed was too big to fit in the living room that we had to use the small couch to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights just before the Christmas holidays. The staff on the desk and the doorman were always very friendly and helpful. It felt safe and welcoming, (the other posters have noted the number of homeless people but that is common in the city). We had an urban suite, which would be great for a couple but it is small once the sofa became a bed and the cushions have to be stowed. There were only bedside cabinet/lighting facilities on one side of the king bed and on the no-light side, about a 6 inch gap between the side of the bed and the wall. That was a bit odd. It got very cold during the day and there did not seem to be a thermostat in the room. The kids in the 5th floor suite above partied hard but were gone by evening of day 2. That sounds a bit down but if you are looking for a reasonably priced suite that is well located for Union Square and the trams, Muni, buses etc, this would be a good option. The restaurant next door, Puccini and something, was convenient but the food was just OK and it seems overly expensive. The Cafe Mason was excellent for breakfast - turn left out of the hotel and right on Mason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: SFHappy5
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Hotel Abri and it was very easy to find and close to everything. It was an easy walk to Union Square, where we shopped, ate, and ice skated. We were greeted immediately upon driving up to the hotel by a very nice doorman. The wonderful service continued at the front desk with staff that knew exactly what we needed with 3 children in tow. Since our stay, I have recommended Hotel Abri to friends and family and will continue to do so. We are already planning our next trip to San Francisco and will be sure to stay at the Abri again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel by Union Square”
Reviews.Author: pancakeandeggs
Reviews.Content: Overall: Great hotel considering its price, location, and quality. Rooms are new, comfortable and tastefully decorated. It is located in a central part of SF close to transportation and dining and service is great. Rooms: Decent size considering that hotels in SF tend to be on the smaller side. The rooms are tastefully decorated with modern decor, AC, and has a large flat screen TV. Bed was very comfortable. They also provide very nice complimentary toiletries by L'Occitane. We were in a double room the first night and it was a bit tight. That room also faced the street and the club across the street so it was a bit noisy at night. We closed the windows and still couldn't drown out the sound. The hotel upgraded us to a suite the second night. The suites have a common area with a large flat screen TV, mini-fridge, and a pull-out sofabed. There is a separate bedroom and the bathroom is connected to the bedroom so you have to walk through the bedroom to use the restroom. One odd thing about the restroom is that they have an opaque glass door so you can kind of see into the restroom, especially if the restroom light is on and the bedroom light is off. Location: The hotel is a couple of blocks from Union Square, the Westfield shopping center, and close to the Powell Street BART station so it is really easy to get to/from the airport and around the city. Relatively near the Tenderloin area so you may see some bums if you wander in the wrong direction but we didn't have any problems. There is a Walgreens nearby for anything you might need and there is a Subway and Cold Stone right next door (but I recommend getting frozen yogurt from Blondie's around the corner instead). We didn't have a car but I think parking is about $25/night. Service: Staff is great. They were very helpful and provided directions, maps, restaurant recommendations, etc. There is always someone at the front desk so it was nice to have someone to ask for recommendations any time of day as opposed to waiting for the concierge hours.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice retreat near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: bkjSeattle
Reviews.Content: Reviewed many hotels in SF. This hotel had consistently positive reviews and priced at $99 / nite Stayed one nite. Super convenient location .Very helpful front desk staff. Clean, quiet, quality bath products. I will stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great- location, rooms, bedding, dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Mir_of_Sactown
Reviews.Content: You almost wouldn't know this hotel was there- right on a small corner just before the cable car rail. Beautifully decorated, and very cozy. The hotel was dog friendly, and we chose where we stay based upon this amenity. We had the suite- which was perfect for the small group of friends we had- with 2 flat screens you could hook up your MP3 player to and windows you could even open for fresh air! I would definitely recommend this hotel, and return here- the first hotel I can say that about- and I've stayed at many in the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Great Hotel! Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: rjintx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week for 5 nights. We had an interior King Suite on the 5th floor. It was very comfortable and QUIET, which according to reviews I have read of other hotels, is not an easy thing to find in Union Sq. True to other reviews, the staff was FANTASTIC! The concierge, Hillary, was extremely helpful with booking transportation, tours, special arrangements, anything I asked. And the doormen/bellmen went above and beyond and make it a point to remember you by name. They all make an effort to be the best and it shows. And they have FREE Wi-Fi.....they get big points for that alone! The location was perfect, trolley, cable car turnaround, and BART are all literally around the corner. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance and a Walgreen's right around the corner for all those essentials you may have forgotten. There is an italian restaurant attached but we did not get a chance to eat there, although it smelled great and looked to be pretty full every night so that's a good sign. A BIG factor for me in reviewing a hotel is whether or not the beds are comfortable. If you've ever had an uncomfortable bed you know it can ruin a vacation. The beds here are outstanding in my opinion. Very comfortable and cozy. I gave the room 4 out of 5 because there were a few minor things I thought were lacking, such as no mirror outside the bathroom, and no full length mirror, and the towels, while they looked to be new, were not very soft. Also, we like it very cold when we sleep and the window AC unit struggled at times, but it did an ok job, it's not like it was hot outside so it was still comfortable. These are extremely minor things and it would not deter me from staying there again. I just feel there is a little room for improvement. Overall, for the price we paid we felt we got an amazing experience at Hotel Abri and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the Union Sq. area. I walked down to the Westin for a masage in their spa and the lobby was so crowded and noisy, I was virtually unseen. I almost booked us at the Westin but after reading the great reviews of Hotel Abri decided to go with it......SO glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “Best service and value”
Reviews.Author: JDMcK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abri for 3 nights in the Urban Suite. We got a great deal on the room, large, plenty of space and was so comfortable we really felt at home. The service was amazing, nice and polite and would do whatever possible to ensure you enjoyed your stay. Abri is in a great location, a big Westfield shopping mall down the street and one block from Union Square. It's a great place to access transport and even has a cable car stop meters away. The area was safe, be aware that there is homeless people around, particularly around hotel's and food places (we didn't come across anyone aggressive and were all very well mannered). Hotel Abri also has a business center (meeting rooms, internet, printing facilities etc). We used the free internet access and printing facilities to plan our day and also to print tickets. I'd recommend asking the concierge to book a Go-Car for you as it's a great way to see San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation”
Reviews.Author: Italiandreams
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Monticello many times over the years, but the new Hotel Abri's renovation is the best I've seen. It is now sleek, comfortable, and elegant with top amenities. It is only 2 half blocks from the Powell Street cable car and the BART station which makes it an exceptional location. It is a close walk to the Moscone Convention Center and only a block from Union Square. It's also a block from the huge shopping center on Market that has Nordstrom and other great shops. The location can't be beat. The service was over the top - they even remembered our names after the first day. That's pretty amazing! The bed in our room was so comfortable and the work desk and free WiFi makes Marriott and other hotels who charge for internet look ridiculous. We had room 522 which was just fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Amazing Price”
Reviews.Author: Pat909
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel Abri and would have extended our stay if we could. The price was great--around $90, I think. Upon check in we were upgraded to a two room suite on the interior of the hotel. The room was big, clean, and modern. Every time we passed through the lobby, the staff made eye contact and greeted us. This hotel is right in Union Square, but there was a doorman so we always felt safe entering the hotel late at night. I've been recommending this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “warm and excellent service. clean, modern, cozy rooms. seriously, the staff is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: peepercake
Reviews.Content: So while i was researching for San Francisco hotels to stay at, I read the great reviews for Hotel Abri and I was very suspicious and thought they were fake. However, after my 3 night stay (then an additional one night stay after my overnight trip to Sonoma), I was a believer in all those great reviews. Hotel Abri is a great pick that I highly recommend (if you want to stay in the center of SF, within walking distance of tourist-y stuff). i had a great experience with Hotel Abri. there were some Cons though: 1. low Wi-Fi strength 2. lack of 24-hour room service. 3. lack of counter space in the queen-sized rooms (we had room #509 our first leg of the trip, but the bigger room we were upgraded to--room #507--had a lot of counterspace for all my vanity stuff) what outshines these aforementioned and small grievances is Hotel Abri's stellar staff. A great pick that I'd recommend to a friend. The Hotel room photos are pretty accurate. And the inside-rooms are a little quieter (they pointed that out).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and informative staff”
Reviews.Author: matamama2
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby. Our room was a bit small, but served our needs. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated large rooms in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Hammychen
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Abri - it's a great location close to all the shopping on Powell street (Forever 21, H&M, Macy's) and they have done a great job with the rooms. Spacious, especially for a boutique with great modern furnishings. Definitely recommend and would be back. The staff is very genuine, sweet and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little secret!”
Reviews.Author: AUST76
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Handlery, the Westin and other San Francisco hotels, the Hotel Abri was a great discovery! It is located right in the heart of Union Square and has a great atmosphere. There is a lot of things on the doorstep of the hotel and the staff are only too happy to help you. The rooms are a little on the small side, but are compensated by a large bathroom with nice amentities (l'occitaine) and a room with great mod-cons such as ipod dock, plasma, complimentary wireless etc, etc. I found it so nice to be in a big city and still feel like I was at a friendly boutique hotel with character!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: experiencing
Reviews.Content: It was amazing to visit San Francisco at Hotel Abri in the fall and enjoy the fantastic room, shopping, convention, restaurants and hospitality, for its price its like finding a treasure The hotel is an excellent one and we have experienced a nice time. Every time we entered the hotel, we were greeted with a homely reception. This was our first Abri experience and we were very impressed with the room, hotel and your staff. Indy Shrestha, hotel Manager was incredible and went above and beyond the customer service level. After long days and nights it was truly a joy to come back to the comfort of the room. Definitely, we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: wanabtraveling
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abri has an excellent location just minutes from Cable Cars, Muni, Bart and Union Square. Not to mention right next door to the greatest little bar "Puccini & Pinetti. The room was very clean and well kept. But I must say the staff went above and beyond all expectations. They were very helpful,friendly and courteous. I would definitely stay here again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “No car, no problem - Great location, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: dpbalance
Reviews.Content: My brother and I booked two rooms for a two-night, weekend stay. The rates were exremely reasonable considering the downtown location and weekend timetable. The Abri is just around the corner from the Powell Street BART station. We traveled for a week in California using only public transit, so the BART ride from the airport to the hotel was simple and fast. The cable car to Fisherman's Wharf departs a block away, as well. And the Market Street trolleys are equally convenient. One evening we bought ice cream at a nearby shop and just people-watched by the cable car turnaround for 20 minutes or so while licking our cones.Great show! It's also an easy walk to shopping, Chinatown and other notable neighborhoods. It is undeniably an urban location, on the edge of some scruffy blocks. There's a popular nightclub across Ellis Street from the hotel, plus you'll find San Francisco's plentiful "street people" represented in this 'hood, too. Having lived in cities for most of my life, I didn't find this off-putting - just part of the local color. But suburanites with kids in tow might find that disconcerting. Most of the people roaming the streets, though, seemed to be tourists, not locals.. Check-in was friendly and easy. We arrived late after a long flight from the East Coast, hungry but with little ambition or energy for hunting down a good restaurant. We went next door to Puccini & Pinetti, the restaurant affiliated with the hotel. It was terrific. It was crowded, with a wait for tables, so we sat at the bar and ordered wine and small plates of munchies, which came quickly (I had a very good seared tuna plate and my brother had one of their mini pizzas. Total cost for the food: Just $12. We spent more on wine than the food!). Our rooms were compact but efficiently laid out and stylishly appointed. Huge flat-screen TV, desk/work station for my laptop - the wireless Internet worked fine. Big bathroom with shower and very good soaps, lotions, etc. The queen bed and bed linens were extremely comfortable. The AC systems in each room are typical of hotels; not as quiet as I would like, but they cooled the rooms well. I always travel with earplugs anyway, so noise wasn't an issue for me. I appreciated the 12 noon check-out time, which gave us some extra time for a final brunch in San Francisco before we had to leave town. For the location, budget-friendly value, comfort, style and wonderful staff, I would definitely stay at the Abri again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FlaCracker
Reviews.Content: Very well done renovated 1920's hotel. The location is perfect. We had an inside room that was very quiet. The room was big enough, had a new HDTV and a great bed. The bathroom (no tub) was large and user friendly. Everything the hotel provided was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sevenstar09
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 9 nights of our 2 week trip! The staff were so friendly and accomodating. The free internet in the lobby was really handy for booking day trips. We were upgraded to a corner suite over looking ellis steet, although you could sometimes hear people outside the air con disguised it well. Rooms were nicely decorated, tvs were huge and had all the channels. Bathroom was big with lovely l'occtaine products. Only downside to hotel was not having breakfast, but had a list of places that were nearby. Ate in Dotties true blue cafe and Cafe mason a few times, Massive portions!! Alot of homeless people in the area but thats expected in such a big city. Close to all amenities, bart, cable cars, street cars, westfield shopping centre, macys, union square (for bus tours) and everything in walking distance (china town, fishermans wharf) if you like hills!!! Cycled across golden gate bridge and got the ferry back from Sausalito (worth a visit. lovely scenery of san fran), the hotel has brochures with discounts for renting bikes and tours like alcatraz. Steaks in the daily grill were lovely and the food in the cheese cake factory (top floor of macys) was amazing. Hotel was perfect location and couldnt recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible staff, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: bermuda_explorer
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one of the best locations for vacation travelers in the city. Centrally located right next to the BART station, our trip from the airport was a breeze. Additionally, you are right around the corner from the Powell St cable car turnaround. Walk outside and jump on! The lobby is tasteful and hip. Sort of a laid back version of a W. Every staff person we encountered went out of their way to be nice and accomodating. A top 10 in terms of overall service. We had a suite, which was small, but typical compared to other hotel suites in SF. Spotlessly clean, with modern tasteful furnishings. Free wireless. Our ONLY complaint is that our room had the faint smell of Subway. There is a subway on the ground floor, and I'm not sure how it got up that many floors, but the complaint is minor since it may not occur in other rooms. This truly is one the best values and nicest place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Some pros but plenty of cons”
Reviews.Author: MomWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Pros - quick walk to Moscone; inexpensive; staff tried to be attentive Cons - many homeless people, who could at times be quiet aggressive in their panhandling, lingering near the entrance to the hotel; tiny rooms - very difficult for 2 people to stay in 1 room/nowhere to store 2 suitcases; noisy AC/lots of street noise (nightclub is across the street); cleanliness was marginal. Crowning touch was when I left my 4th floor room to check out around 7 AM and was greeted by piles of vomit in multiple locations in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: hcychan
Reviews.Content: We have a group of 4 and stayed in the Urban Suite (1 room w/ king-sized bed, and 1 room with sofa-bed). Bathroom was very spacious. Hotel is right in Union Square, so very convenient for shopping and eating. Staff are friendly and helpful. Nice L'Occitane amenities. The A/C was quite noisy. Hotel did not have extra blankets for our sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not great location”
Reviews.Author: lattegirl
Reviews.Content: Because the hotel is on a small side street, there are homeless people right outside the hotel. It's a bit difficult coming and going from the hotel with young children. A larger hotel has more entry space to control the sidewalk. The lobby was small and quaint. Our room was fine, the a/c didn't work well. We had a junior suite. The bed and pillows very comfy. The bathroom is great and the shower is wonderful. Bath products were top of the line. The restaurant downstairs was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the staff at this little boutique hotel. They were extremely helpful and friendly going out of their way to make our stay comfortable. When we wanted to go to a movie, they printed what was showing at nearby theaters and provided directions to each of them. When we needed a happy hour recommendation, they did the same. The hotel does not serve breakfast, but their are so many places nearby, that it's fun to try other locations. We arrived on a Thursday morning and stayed for three nights. We went to happy hour on Friday night at the restaurant next door. It was very crowded so we took our drinks back to the hotel lobby and drank them in front of the fire while deciding where to go to dinner that evening. The hotel is small -- small lobby and small rooms. Two computers with internet access available in the hotel lobby for guests. I think there was also access in the rooms, but we didn't bring out laptops, so I didn't pay attention. The room itself was small but nicely equipped. The hotel is old, but well-maintained. Brown tones dominated the color. Big, flat-screen TV and in-room refrigerator. Standard coffee maker. Bathroom nice with bath and body works toiletries. Not much room for moving around especially with two large suitcases, but we didn't really need it either. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: r0ckinr0byn
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews saying that the rooms at Abri were small and cramped - this was not the case for us. We had a corner front room (a tad noisy but we turned on the air conditioner to drown out street noise which worked well), which was extremely well appointed and spacious. The bathroom was huge and equipped with lovely L'Occitane products (very good quality). There was plenty of storage as well, and the fridge came in handy for snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay - but would have loved to.”
Reviews.Author: gooseSaintPaul
Reviews.Content: After a long flight and BART ride with our 5 year old daughter, we finally arrived at Hotel Abri. Unfortunately, when we were checking in we discovered that my husband accidentally booked the Hotel Abri for July (2 weeks before we were supposed to arrive in San Francisco). They were fully booked for all the nights we were going to be in San Francisco, but the staff diligently worked to find us another hotel (not advised to arrive in San Francisco without a hotel reserved!). He also reimbursed us the $120 we were charged for not showing up on the first night. While we were not able to stay at this hotel, it looked beautiful and the staff were great. Location is great as we stayed a couple of blocks from here. Would highly recommend based on even our limited experience. Will plan another trip to San Francisco just to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service; stay in interior room away from street noise”
Reviews.Author: Dogger
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here and had a great stay after first night. First night we got a 2nd flr room overlooking Ellis st and the Fusion Lounge. Loud noise until 3:00 am after bar closed and all the taxis and yelling stopped and that was on a Thurs. Next night we were placed in a very nice room; spacious for San Fran and excellent service. Would stay again. Location great if you want to be near all the transportation (Mkt St and cable car)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: goldenred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Abri for 3 nights and was very pleased. The hotel is very clean with modern decor. We were pleasantly surprised to have a bottle of wine with personal greeting on arrival to help us celebrate our Anniversary. We had a room with 2 double beds. Although the room was very small, especially with all our luggage, it was comfortable. Only down side was the noise from the street below. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. There was complimentary coffee in the morning in the lobby and the kids liked the free bubble-gum machine in the lobby too. Location is excellent. We parked in the parking garage across the street ($6 per night when your car is parked after 5pm and out by 8am). This really wasn't a problem since my husband is an early riser. Definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pick”
Reviews.Author: ChicAlbertan
Reviews.Content: Great location, attractive hotel, helpful staff - what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: e-butterfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights here. I found the internet deal less than US$100 per night. Just behind the main shopping area so great location. Lobby is very trendy, the room was not as new or trendy look as the lobby, but for $90something, it's great value for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: phyllishill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Abri for our 36th anniversary. From the first greeting at the front desk the friendly staff gave us exceptional services. We asked for a quiet room, and got one. The manager upgraded us to a suite without our asking and sent us a bottle of wine for our anniversary, with personal greetings! The room itself was very comfortable, and had every amenity we could have asked for. We enjoyed the very comfortable bed as well as the two wide screen TV's. The location was perfect. We would definitely stay here again. Even though we don't live too far away, we really felt "on vacation" here at the Abri.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous stay”
Reviews.Author: moremusic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night, walked in without reservation 2 days earlier, the person at the front desk gave us the special internet rate (119$US). We had a marvelous stay and warmly recommend this hotel. Bernard from Canada

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: nmayeda
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri offered the most amiable stay imaginable. Their service is impeccable, the quality of goods (decor, linens, L'Occitane toiletries) is remarkable and their prices are reasonable. The rooms are more spacious than those I have previously encountered in the city and designed optimally. They cover all the bases and then some. The showers were more than accommodating in size and the sleep afforded by the beds is unparalleled. The front desk personnel particularly make Abri endearing. Every single person behind the front desk displays a sincere interest in knowing, assisting and interacting day to day with you. My stay had to be extended and Abri was already booked by that point, but I found myself missing the people and hotel so much that even afterward I was dropping in every opportunity I could just to say hi. Hotel Abri saved me on so many occasions in my trip and I will never stay anywhere else as long as I can - and neither should you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but the Aromatherapy Smell Was Awful.”
Reviews.Author: tracy7314
Reviews.Content: I thought the employees were terrific. My room was perfect and quiet. I felt safe and sound there. The amenities were good although the wifi was a little spotty at times for service. My only complaint and the only reason I would not stay there again was the overpowering use of a scent machine in the lobby. It permeated the lobby and elevator with a very heavy and cloying scent. Anyone with allergies to perfume would not be able to endure this. Thankfully the smell did not extend to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tcracing
Reviews.Content: I would definetly stay here again! This is close to everything! Shopping,Night Life all within walking distance! The staff was great and always greeted you and was great with finding local spots!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Uppsala09
Reviews.Content: The Abri Hotel has a very good location near Union Square. It's easy to hop on and off buses and cable cars as well as the BART just within a block from the hotel. The room nice and clean. Internet was included in our price but the hotel does not offer breakfast. There are however a lot of good places serving breakfast nearby. We had breakfast at Lori's diner a block away and were happy with food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JFs_thoughts
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice room, pleasant atmosphere. Street noise was just a bit irritating, but the location more than made up for it. We stayed for several days and could easily want or take public transportation to anywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Best. SF Hotel. Evah.”
Reviews.Author: PortPower79
Reviews.Content: My sweety and I had visited San Francisco for an overnight trip and decided since I found a shockingly great price for this hotel and knew the neighbourhood, I figured this had to be good.. Understatement! The Hotel Abri was a stellar hotel; staff is always glad to see you, hotel is kept in immaculate condition, bed was worthy of taking home if it were possible, and L'Occitane toiletries were teh OMGz.. Ginormous flat-screen TV also came with a connection for your laptop so you can use it as a monitor, clock radio also had an iPod dock attached. The only negative out of the entire stay (which the Abri can't really help) was facing another hotel I've visited previously which had a new club open up. And when you have late night clubs in a big city, you also get an occasional drunk being asked to leave said club for acting royally ASBO. Other than that, I'd recommend the Abri if you're looking to splurge a bit for a hotel not far from Powell & Market, a major transit hub and terminus for the Cable Cars just a couple blocks away..

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST”
Reviews.Author: Halluba
Reviews.Content: Best location, great room, excellent service...what more do we want!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Abri is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Higgibear
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a quick 3 night trip to San Francisco with my 18 year old daughter who will be attending college there in the fall. After much research, we decided to try the newly renovated Hotel Abri in the Union Square area. I've stayed at many hotels in the Union Square area in the past and I have to say this is my favorite and one of the best values! The staff at the front desk was very welcoming and friendly, the room was warm, inviting and very quiet, and the bed was so comfortable. Free WiFi. 2 large screen t.v.'s. Bathroom a little small but not bad - - loved that there were drawers and shelves for storage though. We stayed in an Urban Suite on the 5th floor on the courtyard side. The location is fabulous - - just a block from Bart, Muni, and the trolley, plus great shopping, restaurants and theatre within walking distance. My husband and I will be planning many future trips to visit our daughter when she's in school, and we will definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: egondrell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Plenty of shopping places and restaurants nearby. Half a block off of Powell Street near Union Square and one block away from street cars and Bart station. You will not need a car to get around. Hotel and staff are great. Rooms are on the small side, but we only went back at night to sleep. I booked all of our tours online ahead of time and had no problems with any of them. We enjoyed the 5-hour city tour with San Francisco Comprehensive Shuttle Tours. We were also very satisfied with the Wine Country/Muir Woods and Carmel/Monterey Tour with Extranomical. The Alcatraz tour was better than I expected (you must do the audio tour). This was a great vacation for my husband and I. Coming from the humidity of South Louisiana, the cool weather was a pleasant change for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abri: Super friendly home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ubthechange
Reviews.Content: With 91 rooms, Hotel Abri shines following its $10 million renovation. I came here for a conference and my coworker stayed across the street at Parc 55, also a very nice hotel but a lot more expensive. Hotel Abri provides cozy, albeit small rooms stylishly decorated in clean lines with a modern Asian flare. Rooms include huge flat screen tv, refrigerator, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, alarm clock/radio, air conditioning (which you seldom need in San Francisco). Room service is available. There is no exercise room but this is a city where you can do a ton of walking. My room faced into the courtyard so although we're in the heart of the city, it was quiet even with the windows open. Lots of great restaurants nearby and Hotel Abri provides a list of best breakfast and dinner spots. Larger suites are also available. The front desk staff was terrific -- very helpful when it came to navigating the city. I love this place. It's less expensive than bigger hotels and much quainter. Super place. Super experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JGL50
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a fantastic location, be treated with warmth and respect by the entire staff, and sleep in a wonderful bed in a beautiful room, try the Abri. That's what we did recently (based on the great reviews we read on TripAdvisor). Without our asking, Karen at the registration desk (she's wonderful!) upgraded us to a suite on the second floor. In our 30+ years of marriage, we've stayed in many, many hotels, but we've never had a better experience. We are recommending the Abri to anyone we know headed to SF.

Reviews.Title: “A great find.. location, service and room all exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: SydneyShane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Abri at the end of May for a weekend. Here are a few things that might help if you are considering this hotel. Getting there: We flew in to SFO and simply hopped on the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transport) which takes you straight into the city. Hotel Abri is just around the corner from Powell St station, we were jet lagged this was a god send just how easy it was to find and the BART is by far the cheapest option to get to and from the Airport. The cable car line turnaround is at the end of the street and the the street car/tram/trolley whatever you want to call them right behind that. Transport was a breeze. There is a booth near the Cable Car turnaround where you can get a daily transport passport giving you unlimited rides on all the buses cable cars and street cars for 11 bucks. Hotel Check-in/staff: The staff were absolutley fantastic. Hillary the concierge was fantastic, its not often that you there service is so good that you can remember the persons name. There was a problem with our airport connection (we had a really early flight out ) and when they contacted the hotel through the night she rebooked our transfer for us so as not to disturb us. Housekeeping left the room spotless. The hotel is definitely well run. Amenities: No Gym or Pool but this didnt worry us at all there, is an adjoining italian restaurant which was delicious. Complimentary internet/PC use was so helpful. In room safe (many hotels are reverting to only having deposit boxes at reception - worth checking). Everything in this hotel was new - nothing dodgy at all. Room: The king size bed was divine, decent linen, funishings were new with a decent size bathroom - (Loccitane products). Room wasnt large but this is usual in nearly all the San Fran hotels I've stayed in. If you are a light sleeper they also have an inside room option it was nice to open up the window and watch the world go by outside. Noise: The hotel is away from the cable car line however there is a nightclub just across the road, and it did get a bit noisier on Saturday night, not from music but people out on the street. If you are a light sleeper take your earplugs or request an inside room. Shopping : Westfield San Francisco Centre is a minute away and union Square is just up the hill. No shortage of options at all. Food Options: EVERYWHERE catering to every budget, theres a cold rock ice-creamery next door too. yum. If you are looking for a nice place for lunch on a sunny day the I recommend the Cheesecake Factory on top of the Macy's building, it has an outdoor seating area looking down into the square. Great location. The hotel has a breakfast listing of the best places nearby to head out for breakfast - We went to a place a few blocks away called Dotties - food was delicious but get there early we were there before it opened on Saturday and there was already a line. The place is small and cosy but well worth a visit. The Farmers Market is also a great spot to walk through for brunch if your're looking for a gourmet bite Booking: I booked through expedia and got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, amazing staff, amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelguy68
Reviews.Content: I work for a Four Star Property in West Hollywood, so I am very particular when it comes to hotels. And my girlfriend is even MORE particular. So my expectations were sky high when I checked into Hotel Abri. For those of you who haven't stayed in boutique style hotels in San Francisco, let me tell you that there are only a few hotels that are world class. Well, you can put Hotel Abri at the top of the list. The hotel layout and design was beautiful- modern and hip yet very comfortable. Many Union Square area hotels have smaller rooms, but the suite we stayed in was big enough to get lost in and had two great views. But the key to any hotel is the service, and the ENTIRE STAFF WAS AMAZING. From getting us on the guest list in clubs, to the bell staff giving us directions and recommendations, to remembering our names (and we remember yours Karen!) the staff has the customer service down cold. Larkspur Hotels always come correct (Villa Florence is great too) but I have to give the edge to Abri. I go to The City quarterly; Abri can count on me 4 times a year from now on. T-roy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: totallynewbie
Reviews.Content: I visited SF for first time and i choose hotel Abri and i couldn't have done better hotel. The hotel was convenient to the BART, trolleys, shopping, movies..you name it; perfect when i didn't rent a car. I got a great deal from http://www.travel-ticker.com/ $89 per night. I need a DVD player, which the hotel was nice enough let me borrow for a couple of days. I needed to order Chinese so i called the front desk. They were nice enough to print the menu of local restaurant which delivered and bring to my room. I requested a room on a high floor(3rd floor) and quite which i received. The room was cleaned every day and it looked cleaned. Downside to this hotel is that a club called Hotel Fusion Club is across the street so you hear people, car, police all the time on weekends but i was too tired to pay attention to that most of the time. I would have preferred a higher floor just to avoid hearing the noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: blanck444
Reviews.Content: We loved the location. The rooms were beautifully redecorated with fantastic beds and bedding. The pillows can never be matched anywhere. Our rooms were quiet and had double black out curtains. I found an excellent price on Hotwire's Travel Ticker promotions which allow you to select a paticular hotel. There is lots of shopping and a nearby trolley stop. I do not think you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, can not fault in any way”
Reviews.Author: Magdalini
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect as it was as central as you could get! The hotel was beautiful and the staff were very helpful as well as friendly. The room was very comfotable and not small like most hotel rooms in San Francisco. Unfortunately I had the room next to the lifts so I could hear the lifts doors open and close which was quite loud so I recommend when you check in you ask to be in a room that is away from the lifts. Otherwise everything was perfect. The free WIFI was very convenient as was the free use of the two computers downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “All the character of the former Monticello ... and more!”
Reviews.Author: TO_Trips
Reviews.Content: Rooms are snug, though we requested and got an upgrade to a King Suite at no extra cost. Just timing, I guess! Fabulous location at the end of the Powell Cable Car line, two blocks from Union Square. Was there for a convention at the Moscone which is two blocks away! A couple of decent restos in the area, but the onsite resto is pretty good! Front line staff is excellent! But, alas, we missed the nightly manager's wine reception which was a feature of the Monticello before it became part of the Larkspur chain and was renovated. The one flaw ... street noise through the window A/C units. And lots of street noise! Recycling bins being emptied in the middle of the night. Traffic. Shouting. Police sirens. I suggested they might want to extend the reno and come up with a better solution for A/C that will keep the noise under control. It's a shame to have an otherwise excellent boutique hotel experience downgraded because of this. That said, we booked while it was under reno a year ago, and by the time we arrived the price had dropped to just over half the original cost ... yes, we had to ask the question, but they were very forthcoming in adjusting the price!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort - Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: jlherlein
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Abri - 1/2 of the trip was business and the other 1/2 was vacation. The location of the hotel is excellent if you like to walk and/or take public transportation (which I do). It's a block from the trolley roundabout and there are loads of shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful - I was really pleased with the level of service during every interaction I had with them. I stayed in a suite and it was great. The layout made sense, the decor was modern and new and the room really comfortable. I did have occasional trouble with the in-room Internet access but it was handled immediately. It is a 3-star hotel but I definitely think that it's a good value for the location and amenities. I'd stay there again and I'd recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, best, awesome, comfortable, gorgeous value!”
Reviews.Author: sandyflowers
Reviews.Content: OK, so I tried to get a bunch of good words in there. This is a great find. Very urban cool without the gag factor. Staff is exceptional, rooms beautiful and bed extremely comfortable. I'm looking up the linens online! Puccini and Pannetti's, the Italian restaurant next door is one of my favs in the city, and my local friends love it too! Hotel couldn't be more convenient to everything, especially the BART/Muni station. I come to the city to see my college aged kid and he and his friends think this place is cool too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, excellent service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TITIME
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abri for 4 nights as part of a USA trip. We have stayed at several Hotels from Vancouver to Las vegas and the Abri was great. The staff couldn't do enough for us, the bar/restaurant next door is great value, especially at happy hour. The cable car turn around is around the corner and the trolley cars run along Market Street and the Bart station is less than a block. We left some property there and they arranged to have it forwarded to Las vegas for us. There are beggars outside but we found that all over San Francisco and no worse at the Abri, some of then funny to speak to and deserving of a dollar. Great spot, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne Beds on a Beer Budget”
Reviews.Author: llamaMamaMarinCounty
Reviews.Content: Killer Bed!! Very nice sheets, lots of cushy pillows (and I bring my own pillow everywhere--but these met even my standards!), very clean duvet--not some moldy quilted job. My husband and I spent a night here in April and were very impressed with the remodeled rooms. Our suite had a king bed, plasma TV, and a very good shower. We had a small sitting room with a foldout sofa, fireplace, desk with WIFI hookup, and a small fridge...the rooms are funky sized but the building is very old so that makes sense.. I will say that our room faced Ellis street and a nightclub was directly across from our room--if you are a light sleeper be sure to ask for a quiet room. We were out very late so the noise was not an issue...Again--great room, great bed, great price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel. Great room, location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Izzy14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abri for 5 nights and loved everything about it!! We booked an Urban Suite as we wanted the extra living room with the pull out sofa as we have two young boys. The main room with the King size bed is quite small however the bed was the most comfortable one I have ever slept in so this more than compensated for the size of the room. The hotel offered free Internet which was great and the staff were extememly friendly and helpful. The location is great. Close to the main shopping area, Union Square, Cable Car and train.

Reviews.Title: “unique boutique”
Reviews.Author: travulluver
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little boutique hotel that's centrally located in San Francisco. It's about a block away from the Powell Street BART station, which makes it very convienient. We took BART straight from the airport to Powell Street Station and saved a ton of money over getting a shuttle, taxi or renting a car and paying out the nose for parking. The rooms are quite small, but they are fairly well appointed with in room wi-fi, L'Occitaine toiletries, i-pod docking stations, bathrobes, and a large flat screen TV. The staff was very, very helpful. If you go, here are some tips: - if you are a light sleeper - request an interior room as the rooms that face the street are very noisy. - have breakfast at Dotties Cafe (about 3 or 4 blocks away) which almost always has a long line, but the food is absolutely tremendous

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LCH84
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The location was excellent, the room was lovely and the staff were extremely helpful and polite. The airline lost one of our suitcases on our journey from London to San Francisco and the staff at Hotel Abri could not have been more helpful. They constantly phoned the airline to check on the status of the missing bag and kept us up to date. They recommended where the best shops were to buy replacement clothes and generally could not have been more helpful. The room was lovely, huge bed, huge shower and huge flat screen TV. My only negative comments would be that the rooms they are a little on the small side and noise from the street below can be heard in the room but then given the very central location I expected this. Overall I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly, Fashionable”
Reviews.Author: yowzatx
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Hotel Abri. This was my second recent visit, and once again I was impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the size of the king room. The location can not be beat, big TV's and working desks are great, and if you want a gigantic room with a huge bathroom, ask for a king corner room - you will be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel/ SF add-ons expensive”
Reviews.Author: stjoesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Abri- we liked everything, the rooms, the decor, the staff, and the location. I would recommend it as a very good place to stay in the Union Square area. My next question: How do you turn a 250 dollar, 2 night stay into a nearly 400 dollar stay with no effort? Answer- stay in the Union Square area. Parking was $42 dollars a night with an extra 17% tax on top of that. Also, there were several large taxes on the hotel room. Seriously, the only difference betwwen the agreed upon price and the much higher price was parking and taxes. I advise you not to take a rental car into the city and be aware that San Francisco is in the business of punitively taxing tourists (because those kind of taxes are easy to pass!)

Reviews.Title: “Ohh its wonderful between the sheets”
Reviews.Author: Warmpeaceful
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over night and it was very nice. Our plane came in at 11 and they were more than willing to accomadate us with the early arrival. The suite was nice and gave additional room for getting dressed and watching T.V. places other than on the bed. But the bed... oh my it was fabulous...we could not believe how wonderful it felt it was the bed the sheets, everything was so soft and it was wonderful. Book this hotel if nothing else to feel how wonderful the bed is.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Abri”
Reviews.Author: EKPE
Reviews.Content: Had a great in San Fran and at hotel Abri. It is a newly renovated, nicely decorated boutique hotel with a new name. The location is perfect if you're going for shopping, restaurants and sightseeing. Two blocks from the Powell BART station - the Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) being a cheep (~$6) and easy way (30-40min) to get downtown from the airport. Got upgraded to a junior suite facing away from the street so definitely can't complain about the size of the room or noise. Lots of nice features to the room; possible to connect a laptop to the TV, play an ipod on the radio, free safe and wireless. They offer free organic coffee and tea in the morning and the business center is equipped with two computers and a printer available free to guests. Very helpful and friendly staff; gave great restaurant and tour recommendations. My only slight complain is the cellphone reception in my room. The room being on the second floor (out of six) facing the courtyard probably had something to do with that.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: dwme1
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research before booking this hotel and am glad I ended up with this one. At first I was uncertain because my room-especially the bathroom counter-top and shower- had not been cleaned thoroughly. After asking the attendant to remedy this the guy they sent up still did a half-[-] job, but after I made my complaints known the room was well cleaned and tidied for the rest of my stay. I was also concerned about noise because my room faced Ellis Street but when I closed the window shade it really dampened out most of it, so it was no problem for me. The room was very comfy...great bed, and the bathroom had a modern feel about it. The downstairs lobby was great and the front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The price I got through the hotel website was actually pretty decent compared to most of the other places I looked at in the area. And, the location is great! I was able to get to Chinatown, The Haight, The Wharf, and North Beach all fairly easily by either walking, bus, or trolley car. Definitely would recommend the Abri.

Reviews.Title: “Really Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MsPugh2U
Reviews.Content: I told my boss I was staying in San Francisco at a hotel in Union Square for $113/night and he looked at me and said, "I'm afraid for you." You DO NOT have to be afraid of the Abri. The rooms are small (tiny, actually), but modern and chic. The beds are comfortable, even if there are about 8,000 pillows on the bed and you'll have to clear off most of them before you make room for yourself in there. Oh, there is no bathtub, if you care about that. The staff is friendly, pleasant, and remembers you. The coffee in the lobby isn't bad at all. You practically stumble out of the Powell Street BART station and you're at the hotel; it's also right by one end of the cable car line and the F line streetcar that takes you over to Embarcadero, where you can get the boat to Alcatraz. There's just about everything in terms of shopping--cheesy teenybopper accessories stores, DSW, Nordie's, Loro Piana--it runs the gamut. Overall, if you're looking for a nice sort of place to lay your head, and want to be sure you're not in the ghetto or the 'burbs, are close to transportation, and don't have to sleep on cheap scratchy flowered bedspreads, you're doing pretty well staying here. Oh, yes, and there's free wireless internet, which is, of course, terrific.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Find In San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DPA2011
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay in the Hotel Abri, having travelled from Dublin, Ireland, and have only great things to say! Having reviewed numerous hotels on the web and trip advisor, we stumbled upon Hotel Abri and were impressed by the many favourable comments from other guests and decided to book it on the strenght of them. On arriving we were immediately greeted by hotel staff who were very welcoming and helpful. Belinda in paraticualr was a pleasure to deal with and made check in a painless process. Adam was always on hand with great tips on where to go / what to do. Our room was lovely, a seperate sitting room with bedroom and bathroom off it. The hotel has been recently refurbished and everything is clean and prtistine. The bed is nearly too comfortable!! The location of this hotel is perfect - right off Union Square and central to the Westfiled Shopping Centre / cable cars / bart etc. Its a nice safe area which helps as there can be certain parts of the city that it would be best not to venture to. I would highly recommend Hotel Abri and would definitely stay there if we return to this beautiful city in the future. For the price you pay you are gettting very good value for money!! Must also say thanks to Hilary on the front desk for all her help!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, average room”
Reviews.Author: chimark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri seems this was just completely remodeled pros: great location for shopping (union square) and transportation (BART, muni, F line, buses, plenty of cabs) and Foley's is nearby which has Murphy's on tap! great front desk staff from our check-in to our check-out, very personable and helpful, fun to talk to. beautifully finished lobby area cool toilet in room with half or full flush option, a great eco decision by them gigantic television in our room 6 pillows provided, so you have a choice to find the one you are comfortable on nice shower, although no tub. cons: the king size bed and desk near the foot of the bed are so close together that you can barely squeeze by, the room is crowded and it'd be tough for someone to use a wheelchair the windows look directly across to other windows of the hotel, you have no privacy unless you sit in darkness the bathroom had no counter or shelf next to the mirror, getting ready was tough; however, there was a shelf closer to the toilet. no breakfast (although apples and bananas were provided downstairs, that counts for something for sure) as you walk through the hotel you can't help but think they finished the rehab quickly or carelessly... numbers on doors are crooked, things in our room were even crooked or not tightened (i.e. bathroom fixtures)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: viablysided
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abri (formerly the Monticello Inn) was lovely for my wife, my 3 year old, and myself. The hotel just reopened in Fall 2008, with redone lobby and rooms. Our stay--for four days--was wonderfully comfortable. It's near the end of the Powell line cable car and Union Square. The rooms are somewhat small, but well-equipped with flat screen TVs, iPod docks, and comfortable beds. The staff was enormously helpful and always attentive. An excellent choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter09
Reviews.Content: The Hotel AbRi as it is now called is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed in. I have been here on business (Oracle Show) and for a small personal break and found the location perfect for everything i could need. The GM (Rob) runs an excellent show with good staff and a great service provided to the guests. The concierge (Hilary) not only arranged for all of my work needs but also made sure that my personal time was used well and provided me with any information and advice I could possibly want. All in all I wish there were more hotels as homely and superb as the now called AbRi. I cannot thank the staff enough for all they have done for me while I stayed in San Francisco, they have made my time here truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Just everything you need”
Reviews.Author: jo_cicco
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel, ideally located downtown. Friendly staff, price is all right, rooms are quite small but not really a problem in SF (who stays locked in a hotel room when you are in such a stunning city?). The complementary breakfast is fine (provided that you like the black, hot liquid they call "coffee" in the U.S) and there is a "wine hour" sort of thing in the late afternoon in the lobby, which is really great. The only downside is that our first room was on Gery street (2d Floor) and we just could not sleep, given the strange, screaming noctambulous population of downtown SF (windows of the front rooms were apparently taken from the wreck of the Titanic and not insulated at all). We just asked for a quieter room the day after, and were kindly moved to the rear rooms with view on the courtyard (with fully insulated, new windows this time, don't ask me why). I wil ldefinitely stay again at the Monticello when in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Monticello”
Reviews.Author: Leety-Lou
Reviews.Content: I booked the Monticello Inn for my family, after reading the positive reviews written here, and was very glad I did. Our suite was huge with two TV's & even bath robes. The concierge went out of his way to get us on our city tour, as we were running a bit late. The location is superb with tram stops & shopping right there. Everything was clean and lovely and I couldn't recommend it enough. Also the best coffee can be found around the corner in the Westfield Centre at Peet's Coffee....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Very Comfortable, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Tourista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monticello Inn for Labor Day weekend. We were 2 couples each with our own room. Upon arrival we were promptly attended to and checked in quickly. Vallet took our vehicle and we headed up to our room. The street it is located on is (Ellis) runs into Powell which is the main street the Trolleys run up and down. This hotel is located in Union Square, your really are in the middle of a great shopping center! Each side you walk you've got shops Adidas, Puma, Bloomingdale's, etc etc! A+ for Location! Once we entered our room, the only negative thing about this whole expreience was the smell of Freshly baked Subway Bread! Ha ha, I believe because of the way the hotel is built the center subway is one level with it's vents on there roof, there roof is also the first floor of the 5 story or so hotel, so it vents into the shaft of sorts and straight into your a/c unit. Big woop! Seeing as we don't like to hibernate in our room when this city is alive, it didn't bother us one bit, except when you woke up in the morning crazy a sandwhich (he he). We reserved a one Bedroom Suite. Upon entering it we were surprised to see how roomy it was. You first enter a living room with a miniature refrigerator, big enough to fit a 2-liter and some can drinks. The Tv is a good sized tv, everything is clean and neat. The couch is comfy as well as the Chair. They have these gorgeous Bay windows with seats built all around it so you can absorb the light if you so choose, cause there isn't much of a view! The bedroom is completley seperate from the living room, there is a door that divides it ( not too common with suites) The decor is exactly as it appears on the website, the stripes look overbearing at first but they are not I assure you! The bed was very comfterble, the sheets where clean. It was very pleasant. The bathroom had a Shower tub Combo, clean as well, no rust or grime build up. This room was a perfect gathering space for us and our friends, seeing as they had gotten a standard room I did look at it and it was very spacious as well. Enjoy the Pictures and the hotel, it is in an incredible location!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Nicest Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brosby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon and cannot fault it. If you are staying in San Francisco you could not want for a better hotel. It is in a great location, has friendly staff and excellent hotel suites. We went for a meal at the hotel restaurant, which I would also recommend. I'm a vegan and the waiter went out of his way to make sure everything was okay for me to eat. He was also incredibly helpful with the wine list and the food was delicious. The little extras which the hotel provides also added to a perfect stay and all for a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in a perfect city”
Reviews.Author: Nellynomates
Reviews.Content: We booked the Monticello after reading the reviews on here and I have to say it didn't disappoint. After a long flight we arrived at the airport, breezed through immigration, collected our suitcases, jumped on the airtrain and hopped on the BART. Whatever you do make sure you do your research first, DO NOT be tempted to pay for a taxi from the airport unless you are staying a long way from any of the BART stations as you will be wasting your money! This hotel is located approx 2 blocks from Powell St station and the trip from the airport cost us $5 each (compared to the $40 it would have cost for a taxi) It really is so easy and takes around 30 mins. Check in was quick and easy and the receptionist couldn't have been more helpful. We had booked a Jefferson Suite and were very pleased with what we had for our money (4 nights for £330) there was a nice little lounge area with fridge, sofa, TV and a small desk, a lovely bedroom with a VERY comfy bed and HUGE TV and a nice, clean bathroom with lovely toiletries! The other bonus that this hotel has is that there is a complimentary breakfast every morning in the library and it really is good. There was a lovely selection of fresh croissants, muffins and fruit with tea and coffee every morning which set us up for the day. If you are staying for 4 or more days I would recommend a MUNI passport. We bought a 7 day passport each ($24 per passport) and this allowed us to hop on and off the cable cars and trolley buses as we wanted which was perfect when we became leg weary! We even had some frivolous trips to and from Fisherman's Wharf each evening just because we could! The only downside to the location of this hotel (and it really is only a minor point) is that there are a few beggars around and about but I have to say that we were never bothered by them and some are extremely talented musicians who helped to while away the time when waiting for the cable cars! One last thing...Make sure you visit TAD's Broiled Steaks, it's on Powell Street about 2 mins from the Monticello and it does the most amazing steaks, you won't be disappointed! All in all the Montecello helped to make our trip to San Francisco perfect and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone...Even my best friend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: Hula22
Reviews.Content: After reading good reviews,we stayed in 3 rooms for 3 nights for a short vacation. Very professional staff, knowledgeable & so convenient to cable cars, BART, shopping. So many good eating places & bar/restaturant right next door. Stayed in Jefferson suite with comfortable bed and pull out in next rm & refrig too. & each had its on TV. Free wireless & continental breakfast (muffins, banana/apples, Starbucks coffee (yum) & free wine 5-6pm. Many perks and our family of 7 adults & 2 children fully enjoyed the spacious lobby. Hotel is so San Fran--not modern but clean & toiletries were of good quality. Towels & washcloths nice & thick. Tub kind of slick, no bars to hold onto & 2 family members slipped. Other than that, it is a great value though we paid higher price because it was a busy time. Didn't use valet parking-- very expensive & we had oversized van..checkout other parking lots in city for lower prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gfkeys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend of Sept 23rd, had a great time in the city, Room was clean and nicely appointed, Hotel service was excellent, They made reservations for us for dinner at a local restaurant for Sunday night while we were riding bicycles all day. I would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monticello!!”
Reviews.Author: rgwdfw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at The Monticello Inn and can't wait to go back! We found The Monticello online and actually found the lowest rate directly through the hotel's website. Everything about the hotel was superb - the price, the location, the cleanliness and comfort, the decor, the free breakfast and afternoon wine reception and, most of all, the staff. We took BART from the airport for $5 each and it put us within a block of the hotel. Although we arrived extremely early in the day, we were able to check in by noon. The room was a nice size, the bed comfortable and the linens very nice. It we also extremely quiet in the hallways - we almost never heard anyone coming or going and the hotel seemed pretty full. The restaurant next door was closed for renovation most of the time we were there but there is no shortage of good places to eat close by since we were only two blocks from Union Square. A great place for dim sum is just a half a block away and a fun diner is just up Powel St. The best part of our stay at The Monticello was the staff - always helpful, friendly and patient. We would recommend this hotel toanyone and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Monticello Inn very pleasant, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: butchermarie
Reviews.Content: Although small, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. I especially enjoyed the comfortable beds and pillows. Each evening the hotel provides wine and coffee for hotel guests during a gathering in the hotel lobby. The morning continental breakfast was not out of the ordinary -- croissants, muffins, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, although it was certainly acequate. However, the hotel desk staff and concierge were extraordinarily accomodating and pleasant. Rates are good -- shop around as you can find differences of as much as $20/day. The location is 3 blocks from Union Square, 1 block from the Powell/Mason cable car turnaround, 1 block from BART. I would definitely recommend Monticello Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location, Staff, and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: HMMR
Reviews.Content: The Monticello was recommended to us by another friend who had researched it but had not yet checked in to stay. When searching for a hotel we were concerned with location to public transportation, an included breakfast and a quiet spacious room since we would be in San Fran for a week. The Monticello provided all of these things along with an evening wine reception, exceedingly friendly and accomodating staff who got to know us and regularly asked about our day or evening and whether we needed anything. We can't say enough about the location as we took BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) from the airport for about $5 each and came out 1 block from the hotel at the Powell Street station. The street cars, cable cars and buses are all within one block as well. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning which consisted of: coffee, tea, muffins, croissants, various other pastries, and fruit. The only thing missing was juice and/or water as there was nothing for non-coffee/tea drinkers. The complimentary evening wine was either red or white along with some type of bread. The room that we had was a Deluxe King facing a wall but was very quiet yet near the elevator. Since the hotel is on a busy street, I think that we benefited facing the wall. We still had three windows that let daylight in. The room itself was spacious and tastefully decorated with: a king bed, desk, two arm chairs and a small fridge. The bathroom was a decent size with a shower only. The free wireless internet and free lobby internet station allowed us to keep in touch and check-in for our return flight right from the hotel. Everything was super clean throughout the hotel including the lobby bathrooms. We laughed at how often we ran into a housekeeper sweeping the elevators. While here we have already recommended this property to several people who we ran into who were complaining about paying high rates at chain hotels. This was very affordable with their internet special combined with AAA. We would definitely stay at the Monticello again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Lack of Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: CAMom4
Reviews.Content: When we checked in on July 26, we gave them our keys for valet parking since this is downtown. On the 28th the staff brought our van to us with the back window totally burst out. They proceeded to tell us that this was our problem and between us and the parking garage. They did not even apologize. After the garage employee came he told us that if we didn't pitch a fit nothing would get done. I had a pretty big rant on the garage manager who told us it would take 2-3 weeks to get approval to fix.
